reviews.review_text: Absorbs sweat well during physical activity, with a fashionable touch

Jetzt zweimal getestet bei meinen L√§ufen (8 und 10,5 km). Problem war fr√ºher, dass mir nach zwei Kilometern der Schwei√ü von der Stirn in die Augen gelaufen ist, und es nervt dann sehr, die Brille abzunehmen und die Stirn abzuwischen. Diese Stirnb√§nder fangen den Schwei√ü auf und verdunsten ihn nach au√üen, da l√§uft nix mehr runter. Das Material ist d√ºnn und leicht, f√ºhlt sich gut an, die Breite bedeckt die gesamte Stirn bis zu den Augenbrauen (Augenbrauen mit abdecken!). Der Gummizug ist nicht zu eng, aber trotzdem halten die B√§nder recht gut. Und f√ºnf St√ºck kann man gut gebrauchen, wenn man mehrmals die Woche Sport treibt (aber die Waschmaschine nicht t√§glich l√§uft). Apropos - W√§sche bei 40 Grad funktioniert, anschlie√üend an der Luft trocknen. Waschanleitung hab ich leider nicht gefunden, halte das aber auch nicht f√ºr wichtig. Fazit: Tut, was es soll, ich w√ºrde sie wieder kaufen!

These headbands are generous with the material. There is a clear back and front to these bands; they are not just a circle of stretchy material. There are 2 elastic bungee bands in the back that allow easy stretching that remains comfortable throughout the workout. These will not slip off your head because of movement, like others we've tried. The body of the band remains super-absorbant throughout the workout. The front of the band is wide across the forehead and can cover the entire brow. I personally like the patterns  of the cloth, but they are busy.
Good quality hairbands which I use for work to keep my hair in the hairnets more easily. Very comfortable and wash well. Great selection of colours and very good price .

So I‚Äôm a truck driver in Texas and I spend a lot of my day in the 100+ degrees heat, i perspire from my head a lot and it‚Äôs so uncomfortable and embarrassing. I needed a sweat band that was literally invisible under my cap and this product is perfect. It keeps the sweat from rolling down my face and it absorbs it too. I love these sweat bands and the colors are very cool. My work days are so much more comfortable now and no embarrassment when I meet my clients! I will definitely be buying another batch incase they ever discontinue.
I like these but as I sweat really heavily they were not quite up to the job.  But if doing a workout without too much sweat ideal

Nice bands for the $$$  would buy again

As someone who struggles with excessive sweating, working out is very painful for me, so I need to have an absorbent shirt + sweat bands + headband. The traditional ones I used in the past are more difficult to wash, take longer to dry, and are not as stretchy. These are amazing! Especially given that you get 5 of them in a pack - they are very comfortable, cover the entire forehead + more, are super absorbent, and once they have absorbed too much, you can just easily squeeze out any liquid and they are dry again. They can be washed very easily, and they almost have this cooling effect when running/doing cardio. They also stretch easily, without the risk of tearing or falling off. I will definitely be buying more of these, as you can also use them for normal outdoor activities outside the gym - I think you can also wear these outside on a regular basis (if it's your style), and they will look great!

reviews.review_title: Extremely dust prone, nice design. Original band of superior material quality.
reviews.review_text: The band feels better on the skin than the original Charge 5 band. The material, including the lock, is less prone to temperature changes than the original band. Still the classic lock is less appealing than the one on the standard Charge 5 band that has a sleeker tap-on design. Seriously though, the only meaningful downside of this Deep Sea perforated band is that it is very dust prone, can compete with Dyson air purifiers :D Amazon does not let me attache pics to this review to see for yourself. Simple blowing off the dust does clear about 50-60% of the most noticeable dust particles, but the rest remains and needs a hand touch or water cleansing to make it look as new. Update after 2-week usage: In case you happen to spill water while soap washing your hands or similar, get ready to have dried out white dirt piping up quite noticeably from the perforated band. Unlike materials used in Apple Watch, which is quite dust and dirt prone which requires more care. Original Fitbit Charge 5 band is of much better quality, as good as Apple's, than this perforated one. Update after 2-month usage: By the end of 2nd month of daily wearing original band, it looks worth that a year old Apple rubber band.
Best of it kind. Skin can breath through it. Easy to use, Practical. Strong. Durable.

reviews.review_text: I have loved using the Charge 5 - especially tracking steps, tracking exercise, aerobics, heartbeat and tracking my sleep patterns. The only problem that I have had is that it suddenly stopped holding a charge. I would charge it for several hours  and even overnight to achieve 100% charge, but it has been going to zero battery power after just a couple hours of use.

reviews.review_title: Breathability and comfort, but lacks durability
reviews.review_text: The gloves have adequate breathability and are comfortable.  However, after about a month they started to break down.  After about two months the breakdown reached a point where the protection they offered was compromised. I use them 5 days a week for weight training.  So, this could just be an inevitable outcome due to heavy usage.

I am a fan of Adidas products as I think they are better quality than other brands. These gloves fit well, provide enough padding, and are comfortable. I know this may sound dumb, but one of my favorite things about them is this little piece of fabric between the middle fingers that you can use to take the glove off more easily. Lol. Works well to help remove the gloves faster.

reviews.review_title: These are the worst Adidas gloves I've ever had
reviews.review_text: 1st I ordered XL when I'm normally a L size. They were very tight. I then realised that the padding was not padding it was like an extra bit of cloth not actual padding. These were such poor quality I returned them. Cannot believe these are actually an Adidas product!
They are nice and light but durable

When the gloves arrived for me and my spouse, I immediately found that his (large) was too small, and mine (extra-large) was too small. For Europeans and Westerners, the gloves are just too small. In fact, a regular medium needs to buy XL and a regular large needs to buy XXL (for which there is no product available). It's not only that the gloves were thinner than expected and we cannot believe it will last very long. If lifting heavier weights (e.g., more than 25 KG) I would look for other better quality products. It felt thin and cheap, and too tight, from the moment we bought it. Do we regret this purchase? Fortunately it was not expensive and half the price of what is available at local stores. But we have only half satisfied.

I bought my very first pair of grip socks, ever, about a month ago. I found these after some searches and opted for the price, and they have been phenomenal! I use them for football (soccer if you will) games and training. The support and compression is good (I don‚Äôt know much about sock foot support but I can feel a significant difference between these and the adidas football socks). The grip is phenomenal. I used to get a few hot spots here and there once my boots would loosen up with regular socks but not anymore (now at least, more on that later). They fit on my foot and towards my calf is great, feels like it‚Äôs customized to my individual ankle and foot shape. The sweat and water absorption is really good. I feel the sock very moist at the end but with a dry foot. Since they are compression, it can take a bit to get used to them especially the tighter the boots are. For me, it would hurt as I was not used to the compression and then the boot compression so it took me like two weeks (made it tighter each use so once I did get a small hot spot and felt a bit of slipping but it was because I had a looser boot). Overall. My foot feels really secure due to the grip and overall padding thickness and is a great support for footballers at a great price.

I bought this as an additional checked bag as my purchases returning from vacation exceeded my luggage capacity/weight allowance.  Upon receipt of the bag, there was a loose zipper pull which I assume must have fallen off the zipper as the "tail" ends of the zipper were not sewn in properly.  There was still one zipper pull which functioned properly so I sewed the end of the zipper so as to avoid the remaining pull falling off. Although it felt pretty sturdy, I decided to reinforce it with duct tape both around the bottom and around the bag lengthwise, just to be safe. I also duct taped over the zipper to avoid any potential issues.  I forgot to take a photo while full, but from a distance the tape looks like part of the bag :) I filled the bag with approximately 47lbs of items, mostly clothing and items that wouldn't matter if they got crushed/compressed a little.  I wouldn't advise using this bag for breakable items or anything valuable in case the bag is damaged and contents spilled, but it was perfect for my needs, lightweight and the price was right as I avoided having to purchase another $150 suitcase.

The *Vorspack Extra Large Duffle Bag for Travel* is an excellent choice for anyone needing ample storage. As a firefighter, I use it for my station linen, and it keeps everything protected and organized while being easy to carry from station to station. With a generous 200L capacity, it provides plenty of room for all my linen. The bag is made from durable materials, ensuring it can withstand rough handling. I appreciate the multiple compartments that help keep my items organized. The adjustable shoulder strap and padded handles offer comfort during transport. Overall, the Vorspack duffle bag combines functionality and style, making it a reliable companion for anyone in need of a spacious and sturdy bag. Good zipper quality, color I bought is black. reviews.review_title: Great shorts for Basketball, Volleyball, Weights+Gym & Running
reviews.review_text: Under Armour Men's Tech Graphic Shorts are great for basketball, volleyball, weights+gym, running & racquet sports. Fits to mid-thigh or knees. Holds phone, charger, keys. Loose-fit, quick-dry. No lining. Popular: blackgraphite, black/lime surge, dark blue, light blue. MEN'S SPORTS GEAR: A Fitbit. Mouthguards: basketball, heavy weights & contact sports. Manscaped shavers are popular with athletes to keep chest clean-shaven & groin shaved or well-trimmed for hygiene, sports comfort. Wear a jock+cup in hockey, football, baseball (catcher), boxing, MMA, lacrosse, soccer, but a Tonus Elast suspensory jock in non-contact sports. It supports & protects your balls, from shifting motion & torsion, better than compression shorts or a traditional jock. Simpler, cooler, drier, won't squeeze. Flexible waist, adjusts easy, trim excess. No leg-straps: doesn't chafe. The opening allows a quick pee between sports or workouts. Worn under shorts in basketball, volleyball, weights+gym, cross-training, rugby, running, track & field & all racquet sports. Worn under gear in wrestling, rugby, baseball (except catcher), cycling, spinning, riding, mountain & motor biking, climbing, hiking, yoga, pro skateboarding, curling, skiing, snowboarding. At times, sold-out. Best fit: teens/adults = small. Medium for a looser fit, or if you're above average. If active in sports, keep a couple extra shirts, socks & jocks in your locker.

ŸÖŸÖŸäÿ≤ÿßÿ™ ŸáÿßŸÑŸÜŸàÿπ ŸÖŸÜ ÿßŸÑÿ£ÿ∑ŸÇŸÖ: ÿ≥ÿ±Ÿäÿπ ÿßŸÑÿ¨ŸÅÿßŸÅ: ŸáÿßŸÑÿÆÿßÿµŸäÿ© ŸàÿßŸäÿØ ŸÖŸáŸÖÿ© ÿ≠ŸÇ ÿßŸÑÿ¨ŸäŸÖ ŸàÿßŸÑŸÖÿ≥ÿ®ÿ≠ÿå ŸÑÿ£ŸÜŸáÿß ÿ™ŸÖŸÜÿπ ÿ™ÿ±ÿßŸÉŸÖ ÿßŸÑÿπÿ±ŸÇ Ÿàÿ™ÿ≠ÿßŸÅÿ∏ ÿπŸÑŸâ ÿ¨ŸÅÿßŸÅ ÿßŸÑÿ¨ÿ≥ŸÖ. reviews.review_title: How to choose an economical multitool
reviews.review_text: There have been excellent reviews of both the Leatherman Wingman and Rebar, as well as all the others, but because there are so many models, it can be hard to choose which one to buy. I hope to help in the choice of economical "Full-size" multitools, as Leatherman calls a number of models. The "full size" line of tools are all about 100mm long when folded, and include the Charge TTi, the New Wave, the Rebar, and the Wingman. The first two are much more expensive than the latter two, and I will only discuss the Rebar and Wingman. Leatherman multitools can be further subdivided between blade-in and blade-out designs. In the former, you must open the tool to have access to the knife blade(s); in the latter they are available just as they would be in a pocket knife The Rebar is a blade-in design; the Wingman is blade-out. If your most common use of the tool will be for cutting with the knife blade(s), then the Wingman would be more convenient. The Rebar has a much superior shear-type wire-cutter with replaceable blades. The Wingman has a butt-type or pinch-type wire-cutter. Both work, but the Rebar works noticeably better, especially for hard wire. The Rebar has two large blades, a plain blade and a serrated blade; the Wingman has only a single combination blade, but it is instantly available because of the blade-out design. The Rebar has a full-size double-sided file with a serrated edge that can serve as a hack saw. Wingman has what can only be described as a toy, a single-sided, half length file. I could consider it worthless. The Rebar has a full-size wood saw; the Wingman has none. The Wingman, however, has an excellent scissor, the best of the whole line, while the Rebar has no scissor. The Wingman's pliers are spring loaded; not so the Rebar. All the blades, even the small screw-drivers, of the Rebar lock; only the knife and scissor of the Wingman lock. A negative, however, of the Rebar is that the lock-release levers protrude enough to catch if you carry it in your pocket. The Rebar comes with a nylon sheath, while the Wingman has no sheath but does have a good retentive pocket clip. Also the Wingman has a somewhat more rounded shape at the end so it carries better than any of the other full-size multitools in the pocket. Both Rebar and Wingman have a good Phillips screw driver, but the Rebar's is superior. Unlike the Rebar, the Wingman has no awl. At around 22 dollars the Wingman is the best value; the Rebar with sheath is around 37. Which to buy? If you want a multitool small enough to carry in your pocket, one that you will keep in your desk or kitchen junk drawer, if you will mostly use the knife, and find a scissor handy, I'd recommend the Wingman. If, however, you want a more fully competent multitool, that can compare well with the much more expensive Wave and Charge, a tool that includes excellent file, awl, and superior wire cutter, choose the Rebar. What if price is no object? I'd still probably recommend the Rebar. It is noticeably lighter (191 vs 241 g) than the New Wave, and it is 3 mm less in breadth and thickness, which seems little until you hold the two together. The Wave and Charge are simply too big for even occasional pocket use. All of the multitools mentioned in this review are of high quality and will last a long time. Some reviews have said that Leathermans are not made like they used to be, and a review here compares unfavorably the Rebar with the Supertool. (They are similar in design but the Supertool is considerably bigger.) In any case, I have an "old Supertool", made when they still forged "USA" into the pliers, and for the life of me I can see no difference in quality. Certainly the wire cutter of the Rebar is superior. (Incidentally, they are still made in the USA, but a stupid California law keeps them from stamping it on the tool.) So, just buy one, or several, they are all good. I have one in each car, pack, kitchen tool drawer, backpack, etc. I guess you can have too many Lethermen, but I have not gotten there yet!

reviews.review_title: A great multitool for the price.
reviews.review_text: The wingman is the urban-use oriented multitool of the wingman/sidekick family. It omits the saw and small serrated blade of the sidekick for scissors and a package opener. I'm quite impressed with it, for the price it's difficult to find comparable quality multitools. It's surprisingly light and carries well in the pocket with the integrated clip, and the on-board tools are what most people would be likely to use in their home. You end up with a phillips driver, two flathead drivers, a package opener (handy for hard plastic clamshell packages,) a nail file, and a combination can/bottle opener. That's aside from the primary tools which are a fairly nice combination-edge blade and good pair of scissors. All of the tools work quite well, aside perhaps from the 'ruler' function stamped onto the nail file/small flathead screwdriver. The pliers are spring loaded and use anvil-style wire cutters as a cost-saving measure. Nonetheless, they suffice and even handle hard wire fine (though be sure to use the integrated hard wire cutters.) It's not quite the do-anything tool that the wave is, lacking a proper file and a saw, but it's also a good deal cheaper and much more convenient to carry (unless you buy the optional pocket clip for the wave... which brings up the price that much more.) Really, for the price, it's excellent. If you're interested in multitools but put off by the high prices of name-brand models and low quality of generics, the wingman / sidekick are worth a look.

This is a five star product and extremely practical. When I first received it i was very impressed with the quality for it being so inexpensive. I'm going to highlight a few of my favorite features of the multitool: Quality: As i've already stated this is a very high quality multitool. It is made entirely out of stainless steel and has a variety of different tools that lock in place and don't move when you don't want them to. Size: When i was looking at picking up a multitool this was one of my biggest concerns. I didn't want something that was overly large that i wouldn't want to carry in my pocket everywhere but i also wanted something large enough to be practical. This tool is just the right size and fits my needs perfectly. When i'm out and about I do not carry a toolbox around with me and this tool will get you by in a pinch. I wouldn't want to try and hang a door with this but i'm guessing that you probably could... Pliers: This was a must have for me to have in a multitool. I can't even think about how many times i wished i had a pair of pliers with me and didn't (now I do!). I also like the wire cutters on the bottom end of the pliers. Keep in mind that these are cutters and not wire strippers. The Knife: What would a multitool be without a knife? I really like the blade on this tool because part of it is serrated. If you have ever tried cutting rope without a serrated knife that you know how much of a pain that can be. The serrated edge is very thin and extremely sharp. The whole knife is actually really sharp. It also locks open very tightly and doesn't move at all until you depress the release. My one complaint with this knife is that it isn't very easy to open single handed. Other tools: The other tools that are packed away are also nicely made and the perfect size. I've used both the flathead and philips screwdriver and they work flawlessly. The file is... well a file... and the package opener is also very nice. The package open is particularly useful for getting open the bubble style packaging (the clear pain in the butt type that you need to cut open usually). Simply pierce the side of the packaging and pull. It will cut cleanly and not damage the contents. The scissors are also very useful and sharp. Pocket Clip: When i was looking for a multitool this was another must have on my list. I wanted something that i could slip inside of my pocket and not worry about it flopping around in my pocket. I simply place the majority of the tool inside my pocket and clip it onto the pocket with the clip facing out. I'm right handed but like to keep it in my left pocket (phone gets right pocket privileges). Overall: I give this a 5 star rating. This is my first multitool and I don't think that i'm going to be needing to buy another anytime soon because of how well made this is.

Also besonders aufgefallen ist mir das Messer. Ich habe es schon oft benutzt und es ist immer noch scharf. Und wenn ich scharf meine dann ist das auch scharf. Die Kombination des Wellenschliff mit dem normalen Schliff ist f√ºr Allzweckbereiche echt super. Wers mal probiert hat, l√§sst es nicht mehr gehen. Seit dem Kauf ist das Tool ein treuer Begleiter.

reviews.review_title: Great to wear under a motorcycle helmet
reviews.review_text: This works great under a motorcycle helmet to not let sweat get into the foam in your helmet. When it gets dirty, just toss it in the washing washing machine with the rest of your stuff. However, (very important)...do NOT toss it in the dryer. The heat in the dryer will booger up the elastic in the head band and it will not fit right anymore. Just hang it up somewhere and let it air dry. I ruined 2 of these by tossing them into the dryer and the thing that irritates me about it is that nothing is said about this on the packaging. I never complained to the seller and just chalked it up as my ignorance, but the one that I have now has been thru the washer many times with no issues and the elastic is just as it was when I took it out of the package. Good product and a good, fast shipper.
I use the product to have comfort throughout the day and night!

reviews.review_title: It works, but is VERY tight
reviews.review_text: I like that this cooling cap works. I do not like how tight it is. This cuts the blood circulation off to the top of my head, which I do not care for, but it does work to keep the sweat out of my eyes and it does work to keep my head cool when it is wet.
For cyclists who spend a lot of time in the saddle,Even if you wear a helmet these are a must-have to keep the sun off your head. I wear them in the hottest temperatures and have no problems.

Not the cheapest nor the lightest cyclist's pocket multi-tool but everyone of its tools--with the exception of the Torx  bit--fits some part of the cycle I bought it for specifically and the closely fitting ovoid case supplied reduces the rubbing contact in the pocket when carried on the bike. As with any compact multi-tool assembly it would be unsafe to rely on its abilities to achieve correct torque settings in workshop conditions; its forte is the capacity to carry out adjustment and repair at the roadside.  If tempted by its neatness and its quality of finish then do check its specification against the need of your own bike--my pedals for instance respond to the 8mm hex key whilst others may need the 15mm spanner jaw which is not provided (and indeed is rare to find in a pocket tool set) and those folk with aero spokes may need to carry the specific tools for those in addition. On the whole an excellent purchase and I hope it will accompany my journeys for many years to come.

Using this to make small adjustments to my MTB is great, I dont have to keep putting tools down playing the guessing game when its comes to hex sizes. Very compact and the case is nice, the top is a bit stiff initially but loosens up after opening a few times.

I like the respectable weight of the multi tool. Looks and feels good and robust and not cheapo at all. It's just arrived and I am yet to put it to any real use on the road. However, have used at home to tinker with things like saddle height a bit, the handle angle, brifter angle etc. Did the job pretty well. Any hex key would do it too but this gives you a good weighty feel. The tools are a bit hard as of now. I am sure they will ease up a bit with use. The aluminium case is fairly decent too but the lid on top can be a pain to open. It stays in my saddle bag along with the spare tube. Addition on June 24, 2018 - Used the chain tool to break a chain link at home for practice. Worked like a charm. All the items that were stiff have eased up, including the lid of the aluminium case. I am glad that I bought this very useful tool. Folding the tool back has to be precise. Otherwise it doesn't enter the case. But that's fine. Just shows it's a precision engineered product. Every micron matters.

Viene con una caja de metal que esta muy bien para guardarla en casa, pero que en la bici nos hace llevar un poco de paso extra, por lo que yo la dejo en casa y aunque es de aluminio, persa 45 gramos. La herramienta es de acero y el peso es de 172 gramos. Esta en la l√≠nea de otras que he visto. Viene con Herramienta para la cadena para 8,9,10,11,12 velocidades, Llaves hexagonales: 2, 2.5, 3, 4 ,5, 6, 8, Llave abierta 8 y 10 mm, Destornilladores Philips grande y peque√±o y uno plano grande, Llave para radios radios 0, 1, 2, 3 y Llave Torx T-10, T-25. Vamos que trae de todo. He visto en algunas fotos que se oxida, pero eso le pasa a todas las herramientas de acero que no son inoxidables. Esto se puede evitar con un buen mantenimiento o roci√°ndolas con un poco de 3 en 1 cuando estemos largos periodos sin usarlas. Yo al menos es lo que hago. Buena herramienta la verdad, a mi me gusta bastante.

I ordered this bag to hold my iPad Pro and numerous other techie things.  The iPad fit perfectly and there was a spot in front to hold the power cord.  I even was able to put a binder full of notes, (yes, sometimes I still write notes on paper.) in the back pocket.  The lower front pocket has lots of room for earbud cases, other power cords, and all sorts of needed things.  I was able to clip a water bottle on the side as well as holding glasses.  The bag is very durable and well-made.  The velcro closures are very strong and I never have to worry about them coming open if it rubs against something.  I wasn't able to zip the bag closed when I put my laptop in it but it fit in enough that it just barely came over the zipper.  I was able to carry it with no problem. This is a great bag.  It is small in size but has lots of storage room.  Now I don't have to carry my backpack when only carrying a few items.  I highly recommend the Tactical Messenger Bag!!

Negativ: Die Atmungsaktivit√§t hat ihren Preis: Bei Regen sind die Schuhe leider nicht wasserfest. Erw√§hnenswert: Hervorheben m√∂chte ich das gelungene neutrale und dezente Design und die sich dadurch ergebende Vielseitigkeit. Selbst an hei√üen Tagen bleibt der Fu√ü gut bel√ºftet, ohne dass ein W√§rmestau entsteht. Dieser Schuh ist ideal f√ºr alle, die einen bequemen und leichten Freizeitschuh suchen ‚Äì sei es f√ºr Spazierg√§nge, Besorgungen oder B√ºroarbeit. Weniger geeignet ist er f√ºr Menschen, die einen robusten Sportschuh oder einen Schuh f√ºr nasse Wetterbedingungen suchen. Mein Fazit: Die Slip-Ins bieten ein ausgezeichnetes Preis-Leistungs-Verh√§ltnis f√ºr einen l√§ssigen, komfortablen Schuh, der besonders in der warmen Jahreszeit punktet. reviews.review_title: Grip It and Rip It: Adidas Gloves for the Win!
reviews.review_text: I never thought I‚Äôd be this excited about a pair of gloves, but here we are‚ÄîAdidas Performance Women Gloves have completely blown me away! Whether you‚Äôre hitting the gym, going for a run, or braving the cold, these gloves make sure you‚Äôre always in control. Pros:  ‚Ä¢ Perfect Fit: The gloves fit like a second skin, hugging your hands snugly without feeling too tight. No awkward slippage while lifting or exercising‚Äîjust pure comfort.  ‚Ä¢ Breathable: Despite being warm enough for chilly days, they don‚Äôt make your hands sweaty or uncomfortable. I could wear them all day without needing to take a break.  ‚Ä¢ Stylish: The white design is sleek and sporty, perfect for making a statement at the gym or during your outdoor activities. Bonus points for looking cool while getting fit!  ‚Ä¢ Durable: The material feels strong and built to last, so you don‚Äôt have to worry about wear and tear after just a few uses. Cons:  ‚Ä¢ White Might Not Stay White: If you‚Äôre like me and can‚Äôt keep anything clean for more than five minutes, be prepared for a little bit of dirt to sneak in on the gloves.  ‚Ä¢ Not Ideal for Extreme Cold: While they‚Äôre great for general cold weather, if you‚Äôre in frigid conditions, you might need something a little more insulated. Conclusion: Adidas really nailed it with these performance gloves. Stylish, functional, and comfortable‚Äîthey‚Äôre a must-have for any active woman. If you‚Äôre looking to step up your workout gear game and keep your hands in top shape, these gloves are definitely the way to go!

The high-waisted design is a game-changer, giving that perfect snug fit without feeling restrictive. Whether I'm lounging at home or heading out for a casual day, these leggings nail the balance between style and relaxation. The material is breathable, making them ideal for various activities, and the stretch is just right. The attention to detail, like the seamless waistband and the minimalistic design, adds a touch of sophistication. Plus, they wash like a dream ‚Äì no fading or shape loss. reviews.review_title: Not a LLL dupe, but good in its own way.
reviews.review_text: For reference, I‚Äôm 5‚Äô0, waist 24‚Äù, hips 34.5‚Äù. I initially ordered size XS as I was in between sizes and anticipated a snug fit. It was much looser fitting than expected, and the seller kindly sent size XXS. It is still rather loose and too long (I‚Äôm probably too short). The material is soft, though, perfect for yoga. reviews.review_title: No more expensive Lulus, they are perfect
reviews.review_text: I was looking for a pair of high-quality leggings that could handle both workouts and everyday wear, and the CRZ YOGA Leggings did not disappoint! These are now my absolute go-to leggings! Pros: 1) Soft and Comfy ‚Äì The "buttery soft" claim is 100% accurate. The material feels silky smooth, lightweight. 2) These leggings have the right amount of stretch without feeling too tight. They hug my body in all the right places, providing a flattering yet comfortable fit (and waistband does not roll up!) 4) they are my 4th pair they all passed the squat test! No transparency 5) Great for every day! I work from home  ‚Äì These aren‚Äôt just for the gym. They pair well with oversized sweaters, tank tops, or even dressier tops for a casual-chic look. 5) Most important! They are affordable and it is a deal breaker for me. The quality is incredibly close to high-end brands but at a much more budget-friendly price.
These leggings are so comfortable, stylish, softest, buttery feeling‚Ä¶.ever. I love every color they offer, sizing was great and I highly recommend them. Not see through at all and very fitting.

reviews.review_title: Fits nice, size 4/small see sizing in comments
reviews.review_text: Update: when I bought the green leggings there was a different return policy than what is stated now, I am now in dispute with returns because I return the item through Canada Post in a small letter Mailer on recommendation of the post office to save money this company did not at the time offer any free returns or Amazon reimbursements for returns, and I wasn't about to spend more than $10 to return an item that was wrong from the company. We will see what occurs between this but overall disappointing is I should have received a refund by now because it's been a month. Great, feels soft yet strong, have worn twice and they seems decent for the price! Rival to lulu align for sure, just not quite the same fabric - almost prefer these as they are less prone to animals hair and lint fluff sticking. Waiting on a 2nd pair in olive green. Size small fits great, my measurements are 39-40" hips, 30" waist, athletic/soft build. I've always worn size 4 aligns, when my hips were 36" to 40", tried size 6 and they were too big/rolled down so I imagine these in size med would be too big/roll down as well based on others reviews. Hope they last ! Update I had ordered black and green the black fits great but the olive green same size completely wrong size, maybe mis labelled or mis cut. much huge camel toe. I'm going to try the "double stitch" gussetted version in the green.2/5 stars for green, 5/5 for black! (Single stitch)

My wife was all smiles when she opened the package containing the amber and black set of your clips. She was certain that you would sell a lot more of these when she wore them to work as she is a nurse and this is perfect for being able to control bangs and other long hair. She loved how it fit and how easy and quick it was to use. Unfortunately the very first time she went to take it out of her hair it seemed to break at a weak part very close to the middle as shown in the second photograph. We will obviously be trying to return the product but hopefully we will see a replacement offered that passed a better quality inspection protocol. As I started out with,  my wife was all smiles when she saw this product!  It is useful and handy! If only the product could be more thoroughly vetted for quality before leaving the factory there truly would be smiles all around. If you‚Äôve ever been out on the slopes or braving the winter cold, you know how crucial it is to keep your hands warm‚Äîand these Azonee Winter Ski Gloves are a game changer. I used them on a recent snowboarding trip, and I‚Äôm never going back to my old gloves. Pros:  ‚Ä¢ Waterproof & Windproof: I took these bad boys through some serious snowstorms, and my hands stayed warm and dry the entire time. These gloves seal out the wet and wind like a pro, keeping your fingers toasty.  ‚Ä¢ Touchscreen Compatibility: I love that I don‚Äôt have to take off my gloves to check my phone. Whether it‚Äôs texting or snapping a quick photo of the snow, the touchscreen feature works perfectly!  ‚Ä¢ Anti-Slip Grip: The grip on these gloves is amazing. Whether I was holding onto ski poles or gripping my snowboard, I had full control and didn‚Äôt have to worry about slipping or dropping anything.  ‚Ä¢ Super Warm: These gloves are incredibly insulated. I spent hours outside in freezing temperatures, and my hands were warm and cozy the entire time. Perfect for winter activities!  ‚Ä¢ Unisex & Stylish: They fit both men and women comfortably, and let‚Äôs face it‚Äîthey look good too. Stylish, functional, and ready for anything. Cons:  ‚Ä¢ A Little Bulky: If you‚Äôre used to thin, sleek gloves, these may feel a bit bulky. But honestly, I think the extra insulation is worth it for the warmth and protection they provide.  ‚Ä¢ Not for Extreme Cold: While they‚Äôre great for general cold weather, if you‚Äôre in an area with extreme sub-zero temperatures, you might want to look for something even more insulated. Conclusion: The Azonee Winter Ski Gloves have earned their place in my winter gear collection. They keep my hands warm, dry, and functional even in the harshest of conditions. Whether you‚Äôre skiing, snowboarding, or just walking through a snowstorm, these gloves will keep you comfortable and ready for anything.

I'm a swim instructor, and this neoprene top has been a game changer! I'm in the water for three consecutive hours. Not only does this top keep me warm, it also keeps my skin from becoming so over saturated and prune-like. I am extremely impressed with the quality of this top. The zipper is big, sturdy, and has never given me any issues. The material is extremely thick and durable. As far as sizing goes, you want this top to fit tight. As tight as possible without being uncomfortable. Definitely size down at least one size from your normal size, trust me. I purchased my normal size, and while I love the jacket, I wish it were tighter. Size down! The tighter the top fits, the less water will flow in and out if it. That's what you want. I cant say enough good things about this top and I highly recommend it to anyone that spends time in the water. 10/10!!!

reviews.review_title: sch√∂nes Design, gute Qualit√§t und Verarbeitung
reviews.review_text: Ich habe mich f√ºr einen Neoprenanzug entschieden, da ich im See schwimmen gehen m√∂chte, das Wasser aber noch zu k√ºhl ist, um das schon zu tun. Es ist mein erster Neoprenanzug, ich habe noch keinerlei Erfahrung damit, wei√ü nur, dass der gut  und anliegend passen muss. Ich habe mir die anderen Bewertungen durchgelesen und bin zu dem Schluss gekommen, lieber nicht den billigsten aus China zu bestellen und die gr√∂√üere Gr√∂√üe zu nehmen. Ich bin 1,65 cm gro√ü und derzeit (noch) √ºbergewichtig mit ca. 87 kg (krankheits- und stressbedingt), trage derzeit die Gr√∂√üe 44 (Oberk√∂rper) mit einem D-K√∂rbchen und 46 (Unterk√∂rper) und m√∂chte mit Schwimmen nicht nur wieder fitter werden, sondern auch wieder mein altes Gewicht erlangen. Die meisten Neoprenanz√ºge gibt es gar nicht in meiner Gr√∂√üe. Bei diesem bin ich f√ºndig geworden und habe mir die Gr√∂√üe XXL/6 bestellt. Als ich das Teil ausgepackt habe, dachte ich nicht, dass es passen w√ºrde...aber ich bin problemlos in das Ding rein gekommen und dank des Rei√üverschlusses mit langem Band klappt das sogar ohne fremde Hilfe! Der Hals l√§sst sich mittels Klett verstellen und anpassen. Im Spiegel betrachtet, war ich mit dem Anblick zufrieden, mogelt optisch das ein oder andere Pfund schon vor dem Schwimmen weg und ich f√ºhle mich wohl darin. Ausziehen klappt auch gut ohne fremde Hilfe. Ich werde den Anzug demn√§chst in unserem See ausprobieren und meine Rezension dann um diese Erfahrung erweitern. Nachtrag: konnte wegen der regnerischen Witterung den Anzug nun doch nicht ausprobieren...inzwischen konnte ich ein paar Kilos an Gewicht loswerden - jetzt ist allerdings der Anzug etwas zu locker, so dass ich den nun unbenutzt zur√ºckschicken muss. Die f√ºnf Sterne hat er allemal verdient...f√ºr meine Gewichts√§nderung kann das Ding ja schlie√ülich nix. F√ºr's n√§chste Jahr schau ich dann mal...vielleicht kauf ich mir den gleichen dann 1 oder sogar 2 Nummern kleiner, den jetzt ist der See schon so temperiert, dass ich ihn nicht mehr brauche

A little fraying at a seam but we were up against concrete and boulder too.  Very nice colors.  I thought we ordered the white and black but pink and black came in. Luckily she loves pink also.

reviews.review_title: Can't use for diving, it lets water in
reviews.review_text: It's true to size. Material is a bit thick, but not thick enough or not secured enough not to let water in. At the nech and wrists this is where it lets water in. Tried it in a swimming pool and I was still able to feel the cold. It's okay if you wanted a covered swimsuit that fries fast but not the best for diving. I loved the design and the variety of colors.

Update: I reduced the rating to 1 star after I tried the wetsuit in scuba diving a couple of days ago. Originally the fit was perfect however in the water the suit expanded to at least 2 sizes larger due to poor material used. it almost felt like wearing a wet tarp. There is no marking that this is a 3 mm thickness and it felt like it was 5 or even 7 mm suit. Once wet it is very hard to get out of and even when damp it is very hard to get in. As suspected the zipper is loose and it slides down and the only thing that is keeping it in place is the BCD. it is extremely heavy when wet and it keeps water in the fabric. Not worth the money and I would NOT recommend it. I have tried different wetsuits over the years and I could never find one that is perfect in fitting and reasonable price. I am 5,9 185lbs 42inch chest and 34-35 waist.  I ordered the large size in black and gray.  It fits perfectly.  The zippers at sleeves and the legs are great for ease of putting it on and taking it off.  I liked it so much that I ordered a second one immediately. The front zipper is also great for unassisted wearing it.  So why the 4 stars? The neck Velcro does not cover the zipper when it is pulled all the way up.  I have not tried these in the water yet and I will update this review when I do.  But I suspect that the zipper may slide down if it is not secured by the neck Velcro like some other wetsuits that have the zipper on the back do.  So we'll see.  Otherwise, very nice and stylish.

reviews.review_title: Elevate Your Surfing/Watersports Experience with GoldFin Men Neoprene Shorts
reviews.review_text: I recently acquired the GoldFin Men Neoprene Shorts, specifically designed to keep you warm while surfing/watersports and I have been happy with the performance and comfort they provide. These 1.5mm/3mm wetsuit pants have proven to be an essential addition to my watersports gear, offering a range of outstanding features that enhance my water adventures. I purchased them based on a recommendation for using them to minimize any chance of water shooting up into my private parts while riding a Seadoo.  haha! 1. Impressive Insulation: The GoldFin Neoprene Shorts excel at keeping you warm and your private parts safe. The combination of 1.5mm and 3mm neoprene provides excellent insulation without sacrificing mobility. Even in brisk conditions, I found that these shorts effectively trap body heat, allowing me to stay in the water. 2. Superb Flexibility: One of the standout features of these wetsuit pants is their exceptional flexibility. The neoprene material is highly elastic, ensuring a snug yet comfortable fit that doesn't restrict movement. Whether doing any kind of watersports - paddling, duck diving, watercrafts/SeaDoo, or catching waves, I felt unrestricted and agile, which is crucial. 3. Quality Craftsmanship: The GoldFin Neoprene Shorts boast top-notch craftsmanship. The seams are well-constructed and reinforced, reducing the risk of water seepage. This attention to detail is a testament to the product's durability and longevity, even in demanding surf conditions. 4. Comfortable Fit: I appreciate the thoughtful design of these wetsuit pants. The adjustable waistband and Velcro closure provide a secure and comfortable fit. They stayed in place throughout my SeaDoo sessions, ensuring I could concentrate on enjoying the ride rather than adjusting my gear. 5. Versatile Thickness Options: The availability of both 1.5mm and 3mm thickness options allows for versatile use in various water temperatures. This flexibility makes them a practical choice for year-round surfing and water sports. 6. Easy Maintenance: Cleaning and maintaining the GoldFin Neoprene Shorts is a breeze. They rinse clean effortlessly, and the quick-drying neoprene material ensures they are ready for your next session in no time. 7. Great Value: Considering their performance and durability, these wetsuit pants offer excellent value for the price. They are a worthwhile investment for anyone who demands quality and comfort from their gear. In conclusion, the GoldFin Men Neoprene Shorts have truly elevated my watersports experience. Their ability to keep you warm, maintain flexibility, and withstand the rigors of water sports make them an essential piece of gear for all levels. Whether you're catching waves in chilly waters or simply seeking comfortable and reliable wetsuit pants, these shorts are a standout choice. I highly recommend the GoldFin Neoprene Shorts to anyone looking to enhance their performance and extend their water adventures. They are a testament to quality and innovation in the world of watersports gear.

The bra cups seem to cover my curves while dry- if they move around too much while wet I‚Äôll toss them and use a sports bra- same as the swim shirt I purchased before this. There is no liner in the lower regions- will update if this is a problem when wet. A pair of biker shorts is my solution for that. If you‚Äôre looking for a neoprene type material this is not it. It‚Äôs more of a heavier swim shirt material. Comfortable and easy to get in to when dry. Update Sept. 2022. Have worn quite a few times this summer. Very pleased with durability. Ended up using a sports bra- wanted more support. Be aware- get as dry as possible before removing- zipper is a little short and is kinda difficult to remove gently when really wet. Hasn‚Äôt been an issue- just be aware of it.

The leggings are longer than my old pair, which I prefer. These are mid-calf on me; my old ones reach just below the knee. And there's a decent-sized hidden pocket that my old pair lacked. But as other people have mentioned, you can hear the stitching pop when you first put them on, so they were made with the wrong thread and/or tension. Still, I'm considering getting them in another color because they're so cute and comfy. For reference, I'm 5'7" 135lb. I bought a Small because the ones I'm replacing are size Small and still fit me. reviews.review_title: It's adjustable to the body I needed a little bigger size.
reviews.review_text: I love the quality of the material the value and soon to use it in the pool. I'm 156lbs 5'3 and I got the medium size which was a perfect fit but wished it was a little bigger. Thank you.
Fits very well and I like the quality. I also like that it comes with matching pieces and is a complete pool outfit.

The print is beautiful and the material is nice. There were a few things that were not great: First, it was difficult to put on because the zipper does not open the full way. There was a piece of material that was sewn about an inch and a half above the bottom of the zipper. That made it a little tricky to get over my hips. Not a deal breaker, but I did have some concern that it would pull over time. Second, the arms and underarm portion were very tight. Everything else felt great. I carry weight in my stomach so I was worried about the waist portion, but the leggings were actually a little loose around the waist. The arms were uncomfortably tight. I do have larger arms, too, so I have this problem sometimes, but usually if it loose in the waist, the arms are okay. Not this one. I felt I couldn't order up a size because then the waist would have been way too loose. That really was the deal breaker for me. If you have normal sized arms, it shouldn't be an issue. It wasn't the most flattering on my body because of my larger belly, but with the option of the swim skirt and the sarong, it was okay. I wasn't expecting miracles, so I think it was good enough given my body shape. It did seem to kind of smooth lumps and bumps so if you aren't middle heavy, I'd say it would be generally flattering. I ended up returning it simply because of the tightness of the arms. Otherwise, I would have been very pleased with it.

reviews.review_title: Extremely Disappointed: Faded Color After Just Two Uses!
reviews.review_text: I recently purchased this swimming suit with high hopes of enjoying my summer swims to the fullest. However, I am incredibly disappointed to share my experience with this product. After just two uses, the color of the pants faded dramatically, leaving me with a suit that looks worn out and cheap. Despite my efforts, the color began fading noticeably, leaving unsightly patches that are far from what I expected from a quality swimming suit. The fading is not only unsightly but also highly inconvenient. I was counting on this suit to last throughout the summer, but its poor quality has left me feeling cheated. Spending hard-earned money on a product that fails to live up to even basic durability standards is incredibly frustrating. Furthermore, I must mention that the fading of the color has not only affected the suit's appearance but also my confidence while wearing it. It's embarrassing to have a swimsuit that looks worn out after just a couple of uses. I would strongly advise against purchasing this swimming suit. The faded color after just two uses is an obvious sign of poor quality and lack of attention to detail. Save your money and look for a more reliable and durable option elsewhere. It's a shame that what should have been a summer highlight turned into a frustrating and regretful purchase.

reviews.review_title: Swimming days are back - saying bye to getting tanned at the pool!
reviews.review_text: I was looking for a swimming costume that was full coverage but still looked stylish! I love swimming but hate getting tanned so my usual swimming costume was just not working for me since I swim in an outdoor pool. A few main points to help you decide whether you want to buy this or not! - Quality of the fabric is amazing, proper swimming costume material - True to size, I'm usually somewhere between US 10-12, but given the material of the costume I went with large, it fit amazingly well. I just didn't use the cap, it's a decent size, if you have long hair and put it into a bun during water activities it would be covered up easily because the cap has extra room. - The chest pads were not a problem for me, stayed in place while swimming.  - The zipper is top quality, really smooth, doesn't get stuck. Because the neckline is so high up, I put the zipper down just an inch or so to feel comfortable (personal preference, not a fan of hi-neck things), it stayed put, didn't go down while swimming either. - The shirt does ride up when you walk, so there are strings on the side (4th picture) that you can put through the loops on the pants and tie them up and keep the shirt in place. - Takes normal amount of time to dry up. - Easy to take off while wet, just wait for the water to dry up just a little bit. - An added benefit, it kind of keep you warm when you step into cold water, maybe it was just me but the pool water definitely did not feel as cold! - If you're expecting the shirt to have an underwear attached to it like a normal swimming costume, then this one doesn't so don't be surprised. It's a proper pants and shirt combo. Definitely recommend, it's cute, it's stylish, it protects you from the sun, and you look great!!!

reviews.review_title: Excellent. Would have been a winner, if only the fit was compatible.
reviews.review_text: I love Cressi suits and use a 5mm 2 piece open-cell suit for cold water free diving. My 11 y/o daughter needed a suit and has become too big for the youth suits, so we purchased this as her first adult-sized suit in XS. For the money, this is a superior suit. Absolutely a BIG step-up from the $70-tier suits. The neck is lined in open-cell neoprene to give an excellent seal (mind those sharp fingernails on this!). The 3mm/2mm makes for a substantial, but fitted/flexible suit. The zip closure is very well designed and rugged. The whole suit seems tough and durable. 1 was glad to see added reinforcing overlays on the knees. The overall design is colorful but classy. This suit (including the zip hardware) looks as good as many of the suits that cost twice as much! After handling and fitting the suit, my opinion is that this Cressi suit would last quite a few years and would hold up to some abuse and neglect too!! The only issue for us was the fit of this suit on my daughter. The cut of the wet suit caused some loose material around the torso. Anyone who has cold-water experience in a wet suit knows that any loose material leads to flushing and sloshing of cold water inside the suit. This negates much of the insulation potential of a wet suit. We swim in really cold water and couldn't go smaller on this model so......... In the end we went with a RipCurl brand suit that cost about 50% more. For that you get more stretch and flex. However, I have to say: This Cressi Morea suit was 85% as good as the more expensive suit!!  If your needs are basic and you can get this Morea suit to fit you well, I would 100% recommend.

reviews.review_title: Perfect for summer open water swimming
reviews.review_text: I am a pear shape with a long body and I was having problems finding a wetsuit to fit me. I wanted one for an upcoming holiday where I would be sea swimming in the UK in June, and then to continue to use it for summer open water swimming. This wetsuit is very easy to get on and do up with the back zip, and it fits me perfectly. The legs and arms are slightly longer than most shorty wetsuits, and I like that. The neck is very high, which can feel strange. It is only 2.5mm and doesn‚Äôt have any extra wind proof coating areas like some other wetsuits I tried. To be honest it doesn‚Äôt feel great quality compared to others, but it was brilliant on holiday. It kept me nice and warm, and it washed well and dried quickly so it was ready for the next day. I think you are paying a bit for the name, as I tried on others of a similar quality for a cheaper price that didn‚Äôt fit, but I am very happy with it. Worth a try, as it also has free returns for Prime members.

Fits well, and is neoprene as advertised. But only an idiot would believe anything about weight loss via these shorts‚Äîa benefit advertised in syntaxless English on the priduct page, unless they‚Äôve fixed that. Neoprene is a (synthetic, chloroprene-derivative) rubber, so they‚Äòll make your skin sweaty, which draws water out of your blood stream and interstitial tissues &c., but (a.) that‚Äôll last for like a day or until you eat something salty, and (b.) being dehydrated is a bad idea if you want to remain functional. If you want to lose weight, drink plenty of water (not soda, juice, or too much caffeine, which is diuretic), eat less and better, and get more exercise. ‚ÄîIn order of importance.

reviews.review_title: Go by your pants size. Also made well
reviews.review_text: Very well made . At first I thought they were a bit tight but give them a minute and they fit just right . I purchased a 34-36 size because I wear a 36 in men's pants size and we all know about vanity sizes. My actual waste measurement is 39" and my hips are 41.5" . I think they should offer hip sizes like they do with women's . But I hope that comparison helps you decide what size to buy because I was confused . I couldn't tell if they used vanity sizing or actual waist measurements . It looks like they are following vanity sizing . So purchase according to your pants size. Also these are supposed to fit snug and not lose otherwise they don't serve the purpose they were supposed to . I am happy with the purchase and I think they are well made .

reviews.review_title: super tight at neckline, which hits at uncomfortable spot--otherwise awesome!
reviews.review_text: There is really only one con to this wetsuit, and it's POSSIBLE that the problem arises because I bought a men's suit and not a women's suit, but I doubt it, given the nature of my complaint. The problem is with the neckline. All of the "ends" of the suit are very tight, which is exactly what you want to keep water from easily flowing through. It's tight around the ankles and wrists. (It actually hurt to take off a sleeve when I first did it, but I quickly learned how to remove the suit without difficulty. It's definitely a GOOD thing that the ankles and wrists are tight.) The neck, though, come up a little onto the neck like a mock turtleneck does, and it's really tight. It feels constricting and uncomfortable. Because it's tight around the neck in particular, it almost feels anxiety-producing, because it has a strangulation feeling. I get that this sounds like a HUGE problem, but it's somehow only a minor one. You definitely do want the neckline to be tight, I think I would just much prefer it if the style wasn't a mock neck, so it was tight at the base of the neck so some of the compression would be absorbed by the collarbone. Otherwise the suit is pretty impressive. It is made of thick material, and it fits well without being skin tight. I am not particularly curvy so I bought the men's suit and it fits really well. (I can't speak to the fit of the women's suit.) It's not baggy anywhere, and tight against the skin without making you feel like a sausage. The ribbon tied to the back zipper is so great, allowing you to easily get into the suit solo. Colors are great, and I mean it's as flattering as a super thick skintight neoprene body suit can be...

I‚Äôm 5 foot 6 (167 CM) and 170 lbs (77 kilos) and the men‚Äôs small is perfectly the right size. Fits like a glove without choking me or squishing my eyes out from my chest. Great flexibility and range of motion in this suit. Bought it for a trip to Mexico to swim with whale sharks and had the best experience! Can hardly wait to learn to scuba so I have more excuses to use this suit!

reviews.review_title: Keeps me warm while surfing in winter near San Fransisco
reviews.review_text: This suit doesn't feel thick or bulky, but it seems to be much warmer than other suits I've used for years. I've tried a lot of suits, too, so I have a lot to compare to. I paired this suit with some neoprene booties, gloves from the same brand, and a hood and I felt comfortable for hours even in 54 degree water!!! This is awesome because it only increases the time I can spend on the water so I love that! I'm 5'4" tall, I weigh about 170lbs (that's about 77.11 kgs for the folks who use metric, like most of the world outside the USA where I am, but I'm still mostly hopeless at converting it, lol), my shoulder measures 16.9 all the way across from arm to arm and bust is 38D/ 44.5", & waist is 34.5 ", hip is 44.5" and I got men's X-small size accidentally but it fit perfectly to my surprise! It fits just like I hoped it would. It is just a bit oversized like I was hoping it would be, but not too much.  It fits perfectly in the shoulder area and the rest also fits like a second skin, without being too tight. At first I thought it might be a bit small as I took it out of the bag it was sent in, but looks can be deceiving.  It fit just fine and sort of molded to my body in the way wetsuit materials do, but it wasn't compressing me anywhere or uncomfortable at all.  It has the usual long zipper pull and velcro at the back of the neck which makes getting into and out of it without help a breeze. Stitching is well-done.  The knees and elbows have a cool zebra pattern that really grips pretty well. It feels like a quality suit. I have used this on many surfing trips and it has performed wonderfully, but what I really love having it for is for kayaking!  When you are in the wind it is even colder than the water so it's important to bundle up correctly! I also love the gloves from this brand which I use for kayaking too! I'm going to have my niece pick out a wetsuit from this brand because I think it outperforms others and will keep her warm while I teach her to surf! Hope this helps!

I've ordered the full wetsuit and neoprene socks by this brand, and both are excellent quality.  The sizing on this one is clearly for men - I'm 5'10" and 180 lbs, and typically wear women's L sizing (10/12), but I think I could wear S or M in this suit.  But our teenager is very tall, so we got one size larger as a compromise so we can all wear this in turns. Our teen is a swimmer and loves being able to use this to swim in the Puget Sound near our house, where it would otherwise be too cold at any time of year to swim.  I like it for sit-on-top kayaking on our SUP in cooler months. The rear zipper with zipper pull makes it a good option for triathlons, and it seems like it will hold up well over time!
My son said the fit was just right and the design allowed him to put it on and zip it up without help. (Not that he or anyone should be surfing or swimming alone. But one does like to dress oneself.)

reviews.review_title: Sizing information which might be helpful
reviews.review_text: Great suit, good features. For my chest size the arms and legs are too loose to keep warm. Really sorry because I wanted to keep it. Too bad there aren‚Äôt bicep and thigh measurements.

Bought this to allow me to swim laps year around in outdoor pool.  Still a bit chilly when I get in at first, but within a minute the water that enters the suit warms up and no more issues after that.  My best guess is it raises the feel like temperature about 10 degrees.  If you are comfortable at 84 degrees, this will allow you to be comfortable at about 74.  I'm being conservative though, think it's a bit better than that. Also been great for sun protection.  Covers arms, back and chest from UV. Lastly, doesn't bother me in the least for laps.  Have swam for 30 minutes a day for a few weeks now and no issues with it stretching or hindering.  But, I'm very casual with swimming.  Someone that wants to compete might have an issue with this effecting their ability to measure progress as there will be some drag.
It‚Äôs nice, only I really have not used this one,

I've never bought or used a wet suit before, but wanted to start paddle boarding in the mountain lakes in late Spring and here in the NW, they are still freezing cold as the snow melts. The suit fit perfectly and was easy to get on. It was cold at first to get into the water, but once I was submersed and the suit filled with water, the suit went to work warming the water trapped between my body and the material. I am happy with my purchase.

I wore it today for my first scuba dive after 25 years. it felt very nice, and easy to put on and off even when wet. I enjoyed my dive a lot. It's a great wetsuit and the price was very fair. I recommend it 100%.
The suit is perfectly fit. Water temperature is 68 F and feeling like in summer.

reviews.review_title: Very good wetsuit. Love its design and price
reviews.review_text: The fit is snug but comfortable, and it provides excellent flexibility while I‚Äôm in the water. The suit is durable and well-made, with great attention to detail in the stitching and zippers. It keeps me warm.

reviews.review_title: Tried a handful - LOVED this one!
reviews.review_text: I'm pretty warm-blooded.  I didn't even want a wetsuit.  But face it.  NorCal water is coooooold.  I tried a bunch on at home & decided to keep this one - I think it looks amazing, even if I don't.  On that note, I'm 5'10" & a simultaneously muscular & portly 240lbs.  I tried on the XL, but ended up going with the L & glad I did. I tried this last week & surprised how much I LOVED IT.  Mobility was great - nice & thin - didn't even notice.  I was super warm (even though January!) & could have stayed out there all day.  Walked right into the water without the normal cringe.  This + booties made *all* the difference. It also didn't make me slip any more on my surfboard, which was really nice.  Not at all harder to paddle either.  It really protected my skin from the sand, cold, rocks, & sun.  Usually I come back with scraped-up legs & chaffed armpits & crotch, tender sand-blasted nipples, raw chest, & walking like I got off a horse (raw inside of the legs).  This time, I was unscathed entirely. Also, because thin, easy to put on & remove.  Bonus!  When I took it off I had essentially no sand on my body.  Didn't need to wash out every nook & cranny 5 times to clean up, honestly a normal once-over would have done the job. I'M SOLD.  Transformed my beach experience.

Perfect to wear with a dive skin for warm water diving! This worked out great for scuba diving in Jamaica in Montego Bay. I went diving for 45 minutes to an hour and I wasn't cold! Used it all week. The Color is phenomenal! PERFECT FIT ordered a Medium I'm 4'11.5inches 153.7lbs and bigger chested. It fit perfect! Even the length was great for petite queens like myself! No weird smells, clean, good quality material, speedy arrival, will be bringing to Jamaica fir scuba diving in warm water with a dive skin underneath. So beyond impressed with my purchase. I received lots of compliments online! Movement is good, zipper was a little hard to mange solo but I did it with time.
Love these wet suits, so much easier to zip up in the front
Good quality but size is smaller than chart.

This is a great quality wetsuit for the money. We took a trip to the Caribbean and the forecast called for highs only in the 60s but we had a full beach day scheduled. I wore this and was perfectly fine in the water! Fit was exactly as advertised
Fits well on legs, bum, arms & chest bit baggy round middle but not bad for money.

Muta da 2.2mm bifoderata, questo significa che ci sar√† sempre un po‚Äô di ricircolo di acqua in quanto non essendoci neoprene a contatto con la pelle non aderisce perfettamente(caratteristica di tutte le mute bifoderate..), molto carino il dettaglio sulle ginocchia. reviews.review_title: Perfect for larking about in the sea but not ow swim proper
reviews.review_text: This arrived promptly, well packaged and in perfect condition. It looks good on ( bearing in mind it's a wetsuit so it looks like a wetsuit) and is true to size. I am 5ft 8, 75kg and small bust and medium fit well as a 12-14 would. Easy to get on and off. It's great in the sea but for ow swim it's a bit too thick, seems to weigh me down and constricting on the chest for breathing with less arm movement. Having bought it for ow swimming I then realised that was not what this suit was for- which it says in the description, so only my own fault but I dont regret it it's a nice suit and comfy for more casual messing. I love it so I keep it for sup and sea but getting a zone 3 suit from wiggle for swimming proper.

The product itself was quality made.  It did have a strong smell to it, which I believe is supposed to be normal. I am 5‚Äô3‚Äù 153lbs.  I ordered a size 12/14.  I normally wear a size 12 in women‚Äôs clothing.  It was way too big for me.  It was baggy on the body and the torso was way too long.  I ordered a short suit in women‚Äôs large in Hevto brand.  It fit much better

reviews.review_title: I am just under 5.1 ft, weight 132.  Got a medium
reviews.review_text: Sleeve length okay, but leg length is long, but should be able to tuck in booties or fold up.  This is a contour suit, so it is shaped for ladies who have more hips than I do--- so the sides along my hips stick out about an inch or two. Tight fit on the top, but that is where I carry my weight.  I can move easily in the suit and it appears to be well made.  Since I got this so I could use a paddle board--- and I am 72 years old--looking perfect in it is not my worry!  Looking forward to trying it out on our neighbor lake on New Years Day!!!

reviews.review_title: They sent me the wrong size-- thank God!
reviews.review_text: Well made for the money.  I bought this for my wife-- she just had to have purple.  But, it does look nice and is flattering to her figure.  She is 5' 7"  130lbs, 36B  Normally she wears a size 6/8 but, the only choice was 4/6 or 8/10  so I went with the larger size.  They made a mistake and sent a 12/14 and it fit!  Legs, hips and chest are perfect-- snug not tight.  The arms are a little loose but, that's the non critical area for heat loss, so she is keeping it.  She loves how it looks and so do I.
I followed the sizing instructions before purchasing and wound up with a wetsuit that was way too big. I felt like I was in a space suit. I still liked the pattern though.

I have given it 5stars because I have already one in size 12/14 and have been pleased with it. However I have recently lost weight and the size 12/14 is now too big. So I tried the next size down 8/10 and it is to small. It's a pity they don't do a size 10/12 as I am sure it would be just right. I have now ordered and received a size 12/14 5mm submerge woman's wetsuit from Mountain Warehouse and it's a good fit I haven't been in the water yet but I am pleased with the fit.

reviews.review_title: Product is excellent true to fit, I am a repeat buyer.

Kundin musste ich den zu gro√üen bis nach Polen retoursenden und fast 15 Euro vorausbezahlen!Trotz vieler Beschwerdemails und Telefonate hatte ich erst am 02.Juli20, den Kaufpreis ohne Versandspesen wieder auf meinem Konto. Wegen unm√∂glicher Gesch√§ftsbedingungen ist die Firma also nicht empfehlenswert. Mit dem Anzug war ich in einem kalten See, ca.15 Grad,  schwimmen ohne zu frieren. Gute Bewegungsfreiheit f√ºr die Arme ist m√∂glich und er sieht h√ºbsch aus.

I'm 5'7", 145-150 lbs (34" bust, 28" waist, 38" hips) and bought size 4-6. The length is perfect but at first, the suit couldn't have been tighter and it was difficult to put on (my mom had to help me zip it up). After a few wears though, it loosened up a bit and adjusted to my body. I wouldn't be able to do crawl or back crawl (the arms and shoulders are still too tight) but just to go swim in the lake for fun, this suit is perfect. It's made all the difference against cold end-of-summer water.

reviews.review_title: Good choice for sun protection / rash guard

reviews.review_title: Die beste Anschaffung die ich get√§tigt habe!
reviews.review_text: Ich war echt skeptisch und habe lange dar√ºber nachgedacht ob es sich lohnt sich einen Neopren anzuschaffen! Aber ja, es lohnt sich!!! Es war nicht so einfach den richtigen Neopren zu finden, denn ich wollte ihn tats√§chlich zum Schwimmen oder zum Aquajogging nutzen. Nicht nur um damit etwas im Wasser zu d√ºmpeln oder um ihn auf nen Board zu nutzen. Armfreiheit war mir wichtig und auch das er gut zu h√§ndeln ist. Was soll ich mit nem Rei√üverschluss auf dem R√ºcken, wenn ein langes B√§ndchen nur st√∂rt und ich nicht richtig rankomme? Die Gr√∂√üenangabe ist tats√§chlich passend. Ich bin 1,83 m gro√ü und habe einen √ºppigen Vorbau, aber auch damit kommt er perfekt zurecht. Alles bleibt an seiner Stelle, er sitzt perfekt und h√§lt angenehm warm wenn das Wetter um einen herum nicht ganz so mitspielt oder man aufgrund der Zeit im Wasser sonst einfach ausk√ºhlen w√ºrde. Am Rei√üverschluss kommt nat√ºrlich etwas Wasser rein, aber es ist ja auch ein Neopren und kein Trockenanzug. Ach, und was mich auch freut: der  Schnitt ist sexy und macht eine tollen Po. Wenn der hier irgendwann durch ist, hole ich mir exakt dasselbe Model noch mal!!! Keine Experimente mehr. Ich war tats√§chlich noch bei einem anderen Anbieter vor Ort (war zuerst ganz begeistert so jemanden gefunden zu haben) der ebenfalls Neopren Badeanz√ºge herstellt und auch auf den Leib schneidert. Ern√ºchterung kam schnell: Nicht so sch√∂nes Material, sa√ü nicht ann√§hernd so gut (da ‚Äûfiel‚Äú fast die halbe Brust raus) und dann hatten die hinten so einen halben Rei√üverschluss den man weder alleine √∂ffnen noch schlie√üen konnte. Klar h√§tte man einen l√§ngeren Zipper daran befestigen k√∂nnen, aber es war nichts da woran man ihn h√§tte am K√∂rper halten k√∂nnen.

I have a pear-type body with small chest and big hips and thighs. Usually it is difficult for me to find one pieces that fit good at the top and the bottom. Specially with swimsuits usually i have to decide wether i want it loose at the hips or the top. I am 5‚Äô4‚Äù and weigh 138 lbs. measurements are something like 34-28-38. I ordered M/L and it actually worked fine. Not big, not impossible to put on. At first I tried it and was not able to get in there comfortably. Couldn‚Äôt get it up enough in between the legs. Was able to zip it completely but in between the legs was sitting low. Since I was sweating after trying it on I took it off and tried another day (dry, with no sweat or water) little by little making sure to get it as high as posible in every section before getting it up in the next section. I was able to get it to fit great. Obviously, it takes some effort since it fits tight (and has to). You have to pull section by section, and be careful to not damage it with the nails. I did the swimming part in a triathlon relay. When I got in the water it felt more loose. Allowed shoulder movement. Overall fit good, was comfortable and allowed me to swim. When I got out of the water, the water that got in (because I opened the chest while inside the water) slowly got out through the ankle and it got a little down in between the legs. But this was because I opened the chest inside the water, water went in and when getting out through the legs it was not supported at the shoulders because I had it down. Overall: - Difficult to get in, but was able to do so ( as with any correct sized wetsuit) - the material stretches more when wet and was comfortable. - Provided good buoyancy - comfortable in the shoulders - comfortable behind the neck

I bought this wetsuit for freediving in the pool.  When it first arrived, I was disappointed I could not immediately put it on.  I found it barely made it over my hips, and hung low in my crotch like an ill fitting pair of pantyhose.  I couldn't get it over my shoulders.  There was no hope of it zipping.  Frustrated, I put it away carefully, and vowed to revisit the next day, and make a decision on whether to return it or not. The next day, I carefully read the instructions, and realized the best way to get this on was not to quickly pull it on like my scuba suits, or lubricate it thoroughly like my opened cell freediving suit, but to carefully invert it, push my feet gently in until it is over my ankles, and then slowly apply it inch by inch, working it up over my body until it reached my shoulders and chest.  After that it went on fine, zipping easily.  This wetsuit is best approached with some mindfulness.  Then you can make peace with it. All in all very satisfied.  Now I have to figure out my buoyancy again...

reviews.review_text: I recently tried a set of colorful headbands, and they‚Äôve been a game changer for my workouts! reviews.review_text: These running headbands from Accezzyoo are fantastic for keeping sweat out of my eyes during intense workout and are much more convenient than a towel. The material is soft, breathable and wicks away moisture quite effectively. They stay in place, even during long runs, indoor cycling, or HIIT sessions, without feeling too tight on your head. My favorite part is that they are easy to wash and maintain. These headbands are a great addition to any athlete's gear, and I'm thoroughly impressed with their quality and performance.

I read the reviews about, it "really" does keep the sweat absorbed. I am not, generally swayed. However, those looked authentic. I saw "synthetic and was even more skeptical.  - However, as one who lifelong sweat through shirts, pants, hats - constantly wiping my eyes in that context, this worked. I was extremely surprised. I just pull it down past my hair line and then push it up, pushing the hair up to. It's kind of a "keith richards" look which is fine with me and actually folks are like, - you look good. The other benefit then is the hair is somewhat dryer; so, when I pull the thing off I'm not a head soaked "troll", so to speak with matted hair. If I leave it on and cool a bit, the hair stays dry. Additionally, I don't feel disgusting if have to without any rinsing put it back on, it's not disgusting like a ball cap, or etc. I suppose the synthetics in this instance are a good thing for "this" context. So, I am actually trying to remember to put one on versus having a towel draped over my shoulder to constantly wipe my face. So, the five packed is plenty and seem like won't unstitch, fly apart, for now. We'll see. If they keep the quality and price point the same, then it's a good deal. It's not "fashion" for me, so if they don't do that, then, - not a good deal. I hope that helps. So, if not in this for the "fashion" but don't like wiping your eye every minute, - try them, as I was glad I did.

reviews.review_title: Workout Essential Soft and Reliable Headbands!
reviews.review_text: These sweat headbands are a lifesaver! I picked up the 3-pack and haven‚Äôt looked back since. They do an excellent job keeping sweat out of my eyes, even during intense workouts. The material is super soft and comfortable‚Äîno annoying itching or slipping especially on my big bald head :). Plus, they‚Äôre lightweight and breathable, so I can wear them for hours without any discomfort. Who knew a simple headband could make such a big difference? If you‚Äôre tired of wiping your forehead every five minutes, these are a must-have!

It takes some getting used to, if you previously didn't use one. It adds heat by lightly insulating where the band is and of course trapping the sweat, which is the point. Still, it's better than having to wipe regularly or let sweat in your eyes. I have to put it all the way down over the edge of my eyebrows/brow ridge to capture all the sweat. I don't fault the band for that but my physiology. Just noting that it's not the most comfortable/pleasant feeling, but it works.

I bought this metal hair band for my husband who has long curly hair and likes to play tennis. He was looking for something that would keep his hair out of his face and also look stylish. I was skeptical about this product at first, but I decided to give it a try based on the positive reviews and the reasonable price. I was pleasantly surprised by the quality and durability of this hair band. It is made of metal, but it is very flexible and comfortable to wear. It does not pull or snag the hair, and it does not slip or slide off the head. It fits snugly and securely, and it can be adjusted to different sizes and shapes of heads. It also looks great on him, and he gets compliments from his friends and teammates. He wears it almost every day, whether he is playing tennis, working out, or just hanging out at home. He says it is very convenient and easy to use, and he does not have to worry about his hair getting in his way or messing up his game. He also likes that it is unisex, so he can share it with me or our daughter if we want to use it. We are very happy with this purchase, and we would recommend it to anyone who is looking for a metal hair band that is functional, fashionable, and affordable. It is a great product that delivers what it promises.
