reviews.review_title: Nothing Quite Like it!  Really Works!
reviews.review_text: I sweat..... A Lot. Excessive sweat, yet another fabulous genetic gift from my parents.  Especially when playing tennis or running.  For years I've always used top quality "heavy-duty" headbands from another manufacturer, and for what they are there are none better. Well constructed and long lasting. I probably have 30 of them, as I cannot run or merely warm-up with a tennis ball without having one on my head. The problem with even the finest quality terrycloth based headbands is that they can only hold so much sweat, as they have no mechanism built in for evaporating the water (sweat). Like a bucket, a top-notch terry-based headband will hold a lot of water until it's at capacity. Once the head band is full it no longer serves any purpose at all and in fact becomes heavy on your head. It also begins to drip, which becomes messy and annoying.  When this occurs I have to replace it with a dry one, which is a pain if your in the midst of running. Not efficient. A good friend of mine gave me a Halo headband as a gift about 3 months ago, indicating that it was the "newest-thing" in headband technology, and is so good that I would only need one for a 10 mile run. My response to that statement was, "not-the-way-I-sweat!"  Well guess what, this thing really works!!! IT'S INCREDIBLE! Not totally sure how it does it's thing, but it works so well that even if you ran 5 miles or played 5 sets of tennis in sweltering heat, soaking the Halo in the process, you could in-fact wear the same one again the next day, with no stickiness or oder from the previous days workout. No kidding! The darn thing never gets heavy with sweat and channels all of the water away from and around your eyes, so there's never any stinging from excessive sweating.  Because the band evaporates the sweat so efficiently, there's no sticky or smelly residue left behind. It's truly amazing! Let's establish one thing right now; whatever your workout description is, you will only need one Halo for the entire time you are working out, end of story. Additionally they wash wonderfully too. The "washing-instructions" suggest you hand wash them, which I did for the first few months but now I simply toss them in with my running clothes, and wash all of it on delicate cycle in cold water.  Then I simply air-dry the bands over night. Works perfectly! Bottom line: Halo Headbands are an awesome product that works well over and over again, a product that I highly recommend. I could go on and on regarding this product but you get the idea here. Now go and get one. GO!

reviews.review_title: This is safety equipment for sweaty cyclists
reviews.review_text: Riding on busy roads is dangerous if you can‚Äôt see because there is sweat in your eyes. I used a narrower version of this wide band previously and I sweat so much it would overflow before the end of the ride. This one allowed me good vision door to door. I can‚Äôt underscore enough the safety this delivers. No hands off to wipe away sweat, no scrunched eyes. But at the end wringing out lots of sweat from the band. Excellent performance. Highly recommended for those who sweat a lot from their head.
Satisfied with product

Great product. Comfortable after adjustment, holds a lot of sweat. I had a lot of trouble wearing a hat and working out. I always had sweat running into my eyes and it would be a lot hotter with a cap on. This is a lot better solution. Will defiantly buy another. The only thing I had an issue with is that it was too tight but I stretched it out, just like an elastic band and fits perfect now.

reviews.review_title: Buy It, You Wont Regret It!
reviews.review_text: Excellent Headband!  well worth the price.  I ride mountain bikes in the hot Texas summer. The material is thin and fits under helmets and hats easily. I normally have sweat running down my face and into my eyes and have had to stop constantly to wipe the sweat off my face.  With the Halo, never a need to stop anymore. The rubber strip at the front of the headband is the key.  Even when the headband is soaked, the strip diverts the sweat around your face to the sides.  As for durability,  I have had my original one for over 3 years and still going strong. not even frayed and rubber strip still intact.  I have bought two others,  I use one for yardwork and keep one in my toolbox.  Sweating in the summer is a part of life here in Texas.  I would highly recommend this for any kind of working in the heat.  They also have many styles and colors for everyone.

reviews.review_title: Excellent for sweat absorbency, but not as wide as described and runs a little tight
reviews.review_text: Straight away, I'll say this absolutely does keep sweat out of your eyes and is quite absorbent. While wearing this, no sweat drips onto my face at all. However, there are some drawbacks to this headband. Overall, I would recommend this, as long as you keep the following in mind: 1. This is not 3 inches wide, or least not mine. At its widest point, mine was 2.35 inches wide. 2. I wear a medium helmet and my hat size is 7-1/8. If I wear this over my ears, it's uncomfortable within an hour. If I wear it over top/behind my ears, it has a tendency to push my ears out. Along with that, if you're wearing a helmet where your head is already taking up the vast majority of the inside, your helmet may be uncomfortably tight or not fit at all with this one. Either way, the fit is a little on the tight side and not very stretchy. If you're a size large in helmets and/or close to a size 8 in hats, I wouldn't recommend this particular Halo model. 3. The inside yellow channel isn't very noticeable once on and isn't uncomfortable. 4. This tends to lose what stretchiness it does have, over time. It will spruce up if you wash it, but please be aware that it does stretch out over time. Overall, given the above, I do recommend this because it works very well at keeping sweat out of the face. So, even with the drawbacks, I think it's worth buying. While it is a bit overpriced, it's not nearly as overpriced as some of the big name cycling clothing brands. Right, so this is a recommend from me as long as your head isn't overly large and/or your helmet isn't a very close fit to your head. Cheers!

This is my fourth Halo Sweat band I‚Äôve purchased - they are very good quality and keep the perspiration at bay... easy to clean and ready for the next adventure I have also purchased recently a few other bands not at $20 per more like $10/x2 they are not a halo however for the cost savings not sure I‚Äôll buy another of these anytime soon

reviews.review_title: Does what it says it will, but I would prefer a thicker material
reviews.review_text: First, when I workout I sweat a ton, like more than any person you know.  Sweat coming off my face never used to bother me, but now that I'm losing my hair it has become a real problem.  Initially, my hope was to find a product that could capture all the sweat coming from my head in an hour long workout, but unfortunately, this product doesn't do the job.  The material used is rather thin and it will get saturated pretty quick for me and then the sweat comes on down on the sides of your head.  The good news is, the way it blocks the sweat from the front of your head works and it doesn't go in to your eyes even if the band itself is saturated.  Also, I should mention I have a very large head and I thought I would be sending this product back pretty quickly if it was too tight.  Fortunately, the material does allow you to stretch it pretty easily and it fits very comfortably and solidly on my head for aggressive workouts.  Ultimately, I haven't found anything better than this and I use it every day so I feel it is definitely worthy of five stars.  However, I would be even more pleased if Halo came out with a thicker material for their Super Wide headband to try and capture even more sweat.  I would buy it in an instance.

This band is made very well and the inside rubberized band will definitely keep sweat our of ones eyes.  I only gave it this lower rating b/c I have short hair and with the short hair and the super width of the band it caused my hair to stick up on the side and back like a clown and did not look very flattering (it's a girl thing).  I'd recommend this super wide band for long hair or for super short hair styles.

reviews.review_title: Life Saver for those in the trades
reviews.review_text: I work in Oil and Gas and I am required to wear a hardhat when on site. This is a lifesaver as it keeps the sweat from running into my eyes. Everyone on our team uses these now. I am sure they will work great for working out / sports, but they truly are a liffesaver for on the job.

reviews.review_title: Do not buy!!!Odd shape does not conform to head
reviews.review_text: JUNK!!!! This is super tight on bottom yet does not fit flush towards top of head and has gap. Not sure if it actaully would fit anyone's head. Still tried it,but definitely poor product. Used for two hours, afterwards it left a red imprint on my forehead for another 3 hours.
This headband was everything we needed. The silicone strip prevents sweat from running down. It's a huge upgrade from your standard sweat bands.
I have used these for years, they are a little pricey but nice quality. They are made of a nice material and help to keep moisture out of your eyes.

reviews.review_title: Halo is great! This version wasn‚Äôt for me.
reviews.review_text: I love the Halo brand of headbands. As a profuse sweater and someone who teaches fitness classes, they‚Äôve been a game changer. I‚Äôm on the petite size with a smaller head, and the wide headbands just don‚Äôt work for me. They look too big on my head and aren‚Äôt flattering. Their smaller, tie back versions meet my my needs perfectly! Don‚Äôt give up on Halo if one size doesn‚Äôt work for you. Find one that does, and you‚Äôll love this band.

reviews.review_title: I have a small head and this was way too tight
reviews.review_text: I have a small head and this was way too tight. I would definitely get a headache cycling.

reviews.review_title: I started trying to get into better shape. I quickly discovered that the bill of ...
reviews.review_text: I have been playing recreational softball my entire adult life. I can probably count on one hand the times I have tried to play softball without wearing a baseball hat: (1) because I grew up playing baseball and it just feels right to wear a hat, and (2) because if I don't, I constantly have sweat running into my eyes. Last year, I started trying to get into better shape. I quickly discovered that the bill of my hat would often get in the way when I was doing different exercises down on the floor, so I got one of the terry cloth style headbands. I found that often the headband would get too saturated and sweat would still flow down into my eyes, so I started looking for alternatives. This is the first headband I tried other than the terry cloth one, and I haven't seen the need to look for anything else. It works as intended and resolves the issue of sweat in my eyes, plus I think it looks a lot less dorky than my old headband.

reviews.review_title: Halo headbands are great, this one is not so great. The wide part doesn't lie flat on the forehead.
reviews.review_text: Let me preface this review by saying that I love the standard Halo Headband. I use them all the time, when they get old I replace them, I give them to people who I work out with who sweat, and I am a firm believer that this design is awesome. I decided to try this " super wide" to see if it might pick up more of the sweat that might escape the headband. The problem is that the top doesn't contour or fit against my forehead. And, I don't have some sort of Neanderthal slopping forehead and prominent brow. But, when I put this headband on, the top part doesn't fit flush and is useless. If I pull the headband down, it doesn't matter. The headband width is not helpful if it isn't contoured to the top or the forehead. So, HALO, I love your product. This one fails. It needs to be contoured at the top to fit and adapt to the shape of the forehead.

reviews.review_title: Better than regular headbands but not Great
reviews.review_text: My heat evacuation system (sweat glands) is the best on the planet.  I live in Texas and during the summer, our average temperature runs from 92 degrees (33 C) to 104 degrees (40 C) and humidity ranges from 50 - 90%.  I have to wring out the sweat every mile (1.6 km).  I think that this version will work better for me in the winter months when our temperatures drop to 34 degrees (1 C) to 56 degrees (13 C) as it will shield my forehead from the wind. If you are sweat at a light to moderate level, these will be a 5 star purchase.

Love this headband! I've been doing a lot of road biking this summer and I'm a heavy sweater. I needed a solution to keep the sweat out of my eyes cuz it blinds me and burns. This headband is a great solution. It's not perfect though. If I'm biking in conditions that are 98 degrees or hotter the sweat pours more than this headband can wick away. Again I'm a very heavy sweater and don't expect this product to work perfectly for me. It works well enough that when I lost my other one I bought another one right away. It works way better than anything else I've tried wearing to keep sweat out of my eyes. I would def recommend this headband. It also looks stylish!

Works really well.  My husband sweats...a lot.  When he's working out or doing yard work the sweat gets in his eyes so he wears the infamous bandana.  This is a nice alternative, that works!  The sweat is kept away from his eyes as promised.  He has a big head (which he'll readily admit to, it's not just me sayin') but this fits well.  We got one to give to his brother also.  That should say something.  Nice product, reasonably priced.

A little less airflow - but keeps the heavy sweat off my forehead and prevents the stinging sweat from dripping behind my glasses and into my eyes.  A dozen washes and no fade or fabric degradation.  Good quality and works awesome

Highly recommended for good head sweat management while undertaking any type of rigorous workout programs.

I was using this as an additional management interface on one of my homelab nodes until I bought another network card. reviews.review_title: Works much better than the cheapest ones
reviews.review_text: I thought that I was wise to buy the cheapest (¬£12-15) version of the 2.5Gbs USB adapters. I thought that they have the same Realtek chip and it is just the branding what may differ. I had a wild ride with those cheapo adapters. They randomly disconnected or Linux could not even recognise them ("bad cable"). They continuously reset themselves, causing the device disconnecting and appearing again on Linux. Forget about them. This adapter so far just works as I hoped it will. No disconnection issues. Connected them to Synology NAS devices and with the extra driver, they works stable and 2.35Gbs speed or about 250MB/s NFS writer speed are achievable. It works on Linux (Proxmox) and it operates stable. (Not like the cheapo version). Windows works as well, but surprisingly it works worst on Windows than on Linux! I tried this unit on a modern HP laptop and it could achieve an iperf3 test around 1-1.5Gbs. I thought maybe there is some constraints on the shared USB bus. But, on Linux, iperf3 runs on 2.35Gbs. Okay, it is maybe one device, so I tested on others. Similar experience.  I tried to update the driver, but no real speed improvement. Luckily Windows was not my main objective. I was not super lucky with OPNsense. The device recognised the adapter and it works with it but it felt like that, even on the switch, the negotiated speed was 2.5Gbs, it may stuck on USB2 speed on my box as the max speed was around 360Mbs. You may be luckier, at least it works and stays stable. After all, I will order these again if I expand my 2.5Gbs network with new devices.
Chegou muito r√°pido vale apena

I have a couple of these that I got when I upgraded my network to 2.5Gbps. I am using one on my Plex server running on a mini PC and it gets great throughput for multiple streams of movies in 1080 or 4k. It was simple to install and just works. One thing you do have to remember, which I didn't realize at first, is that if you move it around to other PC's, the IP address follows it. I got confused by that before I realized it.

reviews.review_title: Great product, difficult to verify on Windows
reviews.review_text: Excellent well-made 2.5G Ethernet dongle. I was about to return the product because I thought it was not delivering the promised speed improvement. I was using iperf3 between two Windows machines connected with a 2.5G switch. The speed in one direction was great, but in the reverse it was worse than the previous 1 Gigabit Eth connection. Luckily I discovered that iperf3 does not work well on Windows, and I used ntttcp instead, as recommended by Microsoft. Now I could confirm 2.5G speeds in both directions.

reviews.review_title: Works Well, But No Port For SD Card
reviews.review_text: Modern laptops seem to only have USB-C ports.  If you want any other kind of ports, you need a hub, such as this UGreen one. I had a hub on my laptop to connect to Ethernet - but that hub failed.  I ordered this one and it worked fine on Etherent. It also provides two USB-A ports and two USB-C ports.  I would have appreciated a port for an SD card but I don't need that very often and I have other hubs that I can use. One thing that might sound unusual is that the cord on this unit is a bit too long.  I'd prefer a bit shorter cord. All-in-all, it works well.

Initially I was very happy with the purchase, however after 5 months the charging port stopped functioning. I'd say if charging is not important, it's a good item, but for me it's crucial. EDIT: Seller offered full refund, so I am changing rating to 5 stars for excellent support.

I wish the connecting cord was a bit longer to suit my needs, and I found that this device (and apparently any others as well) won't work with a USB C extension cable.  I have other uGreen products and that is why I chose this USB C 3.2 hub over other brands.

The adapter is detected by Windows as an additional flash drive, and drive letter is assigned without any problems. Unfortunately no drivers get installed for the wireless feature, and Windows doesn't detect it as a wireless adapter. And whenever the Disk Management settings is accessed to change the letter assigned to the adapter, the Computer Management window completely freezes. Files on the adapter can't be accessed either. So essentially it works as a flash drive which can't be accessed or used for anything.

reviews.review_title: overall ok, but a bit weak
reviews.review_text: Device's antenna sensitivity feels a bit weak when your computer is not in direct vicinity of a router.

reviews.review_title: Brought my old PC back to life
reviews.review_text: I grabbed the UGREEN WiFi 6 adapter after the WiFi on my old computer completely gave up, and honestly, it‚Äôs like having a brand-new machine. My PC used to run on WiFi 4, and it was painfully slow‚Äîconstant buffering, dropped connections, you name it. Now, paired with my WiFi 6 router, the difference is night and day. Speeds are fast and stable, and streaming or downloading big files feels effortless. Setup was a breeze with the built-in driver; it was literally plug-and-play. The only downside is that it‚Äôs a bit bulky, so you‚Äôll want to be careful not to knock it if it‚Äôs sticking out the side of a laptop. But for giving an old PC a fresh lease on life, this little adapter works brilliantly.

Delivered quickly,  installed and set up in 5 minutes.  Surfing the www in 6 minutes.  I bought this to replace a repeater that was giving me trouble.  Now the pc can access the internet without the repeater, at the same speed I got using the repeated. And for 10 bucks. I'm satisfied.

Excellent! My desktop PC was running horribly, laggy and slow and connecting only occasionally. Had not realised my PC was using a wifi 4 dongle and home broadband is wifi 6. Plugged this wifi 6 usb dongle in and WOW! Connected instantly. Fast stable and reliable. Not dropped once in two weeks now. Money very well spent. I particularly like how small the dongle is compared to my old one with a 4" antenna. It's only the size of a small usb flash drive.

Worked perfectly

I grabbed this Wifi dongle to plug into an old computer that I am using in my garage for internet access. It used to be ethernet connected, but I needed to move it to somewhere that doesn't have a port available, so the dongle came to the rescue. Despite saying that this was for Windows 10/11, I can report that his dongle worked perfectly on a Windows 7 32bit sytem with the drivers that were cleverly included on the device itself. Not a hiccup, not a glitch. It just worked. And even though the Wifi coverage in my garage is a little sketchy, I had no problems getting the maximum expected speeds on an internet speed test as well. I am very impressed with this product, and if it continues to work as well as it has done so far, it will have proven to be an invaluable addition to give the old garage computer a bit longer to be useful.

reviews.review_title: Buen adaptador Wi-Fi con un rendimiento s√≥lido, pero con margen de mejora
reviews.review_text: Despu√©s de probar el adaptador UGREEN AX900, puedo afirmar que ofrece una experiencia satisfactoria en general, especialmente para quienes buscan una conexi√≥n WiFi estable y de alta velocidad. Sin embargo, para Linux, el proceso puede ser un poco m√°s t√©cnico, lo que limita su accesibilidad para usuarios menos experimentados. üì° Dise√±o funcional: la antena de alta ganancia de 6 dBi es ajustable, lo que ayuda a maximizar la recepci√≥n de la se√±al. Su construcci√≥n es ligera pero robusta, por lo que es ideal para usar en port√°tiles o equipos de sobremesa. üåê Funciones adicionales: me impresion√≥ su soporte para el modo Soft AP, que permite convertir tu ordenador en un punto de acceso WiFi, algo muy √∫til para compartir conexi√≥n con otros dispositivos. √Åreas de mejora: üñ•Ô∏è Compatibilidad limitada: aunque es compatible con Windows 10/11 y Linux, no funciona con versiones anteriores de Windows ni con macOS, lo que podr√≠a suponer un inconveniente para algunos usuarios. ‚ö° Interfaz USB 2.0: aunque funcional, limita ligeramente las velocidades potenciales de transferencia, especialmente si se consideran las capacidades del wifi 6. üìÑ Documentaci√≥n: aunque incluye un manual, ser√≠a √∫til contar con m√°s detalles sobre la configuraci√≥n avanzada y la resoluci√≥n de problemas en diferentes sistemas operativos. En conclusi√≥n, el UGREEN AX900 es una excelente opci√≥n para los usuarios que buscan una mejora significativa en su conectividad wifi, especialmente si ya cuentan con un enrutador wifi 6. Aunque tiene algunas limitaciones en cuanto a compatibilidad y su interfaz USB, su rendimiento general y sus caracter√≠sticas avanzadas lo convierten en una inversi√≥n valiosa.

As a ugreen fan, I should say it's yet another good product. Big antenna ensures proper connectivity even if your access point is not super close. Although it's not on the highest speed out there, I believe it's fast enough for a home user.

My partner's PC had a few glitches with her WiFi, so we got this as an emergency option. For that it works very well. This is a 1x1 device so it is more limited than the 2x2 device that have 2 antennae. At its maximum speed, it only reaches half the speed of the 2x2. This isn't as bad as it sounds though because most home users are unlikely to see the difference when they connect to the internet as few domestic UK internet connections get anywhere near the maximum for this. Also many home routers are still on WiFi 5 so you won't see any difference until you upgrade your router. Installation on Windows 11 starts by treating the WiFi dongle as thumb-drive with the installation software on it. Once you run the installer, it turns into a WiFi Dongle. This gets around the problem of needing to download drivers for a WiFi when your machine can't access the internet because it has no WiFi.

reviews.review_title: Ottima ricezione e stabilit√† del segnale, avrei preferito poterla direzionare di pi√π...
reviews.review_text: Arriva in una scatola molto semplice ed essenziale. L'antenna si collega al PC e, almeno nel mio caso, √® stato necessario installare i driver manualmente. Una procedura che √® resa particolarmente agevole dall'antenna stessa, che viene vista dal PC anche come dispositivo di archiviazione, basta aprirla e dentro c'√® il setup da avviare. La qualit√† dei materiali non √® chiss√† cosa, si tratta di plastica. L'antenna √® regolabile in inclinazione, si pu√≤ scegliere fra tre livelli di inclinazione: 180, 90, 45. Avrei preferito poterla direzionare in tutte le direzioni, poich√© a volte pu√≤ risultare scomoda in tutte e tre le inclinazioni, a seconda di dove viene messa. L'ho confrontata con altri dispositivi simili, con e senza antenne, diciamo che la differenza c'√® ma √® davvero poca, anche se alla fine dei conti il segnale viene ricevuto un po' meglio da questa. Non ho notato alcun tipo di surriscaldamento durante l'uso prolungato, mentre qualche altra chiavetta Wi-Fi ha iniziato a scaldarsi un po'. I settaggi avanzati non sono purtroppo molti, d'altra parte √® vero che comunque questo √® un dispositivo che normalmente non richiede alcun tipo di configurazione particolare o aggiustamenti. Provandola su un portatile datato, ormai considerabile pezzo storico, ho effettivamente notato una differenza di qualit√† nella ricezione del segnale e nella larghezza di banda utilizzabile. Logicamente, per i meno esperti, questo dispositivo non rende pi√π veloce la connessione, ma sicuramente permette di poterla sfruttare al meglio, ricevendo un segnale pi√π stabile e di qualit√†. In generale, √® un prodotto che mi √® piaciuto, va migliorato, in quanto in alcuni casi come dicevo, in tutte e tre le inclinazioni risulta scomoda, nonostante ci√≤, rispetto a prodotti simili √® innovativa, la consiglio. Valutazioni Qualit√†-prezzo: 9/10 Qualit√† dei materiali: 8/10 Design: 9/10 Praticit√†: 8/10 Resistenza: 8,5/10 Qualit√† del segnale: 9/10 Stabilit√† del segnale: 10/10 Voto generale: 8/10 (NOTA: Il voto generale non si basa sulla media dei voti attribuiti alle singole caratteristiche, ma riflette una valutazione oggettiva e imparziale del prodotto nel suo complesso.)

L'antenna WiFi 6 USB Stick AX900 √® un adattatore wireless potente e compatto che offre connessioni stabili e veloci grazie al supporto per le bande 5GHz e 2.4GHz. E' di rapida installazione ed ha anche una buona velocit√† che appare superiore alle versioni precedenti. L'antenna assicura un'ottima copertura del segnale riducendo interferenze e perdite di connessione anche spostandosi con il portatile nell'ufficio. E' compatibile con Windows 11/10 e Linux, come dicevo l'installazione √® semplice e veloce grazie ai driver plug and play, in definitiva un'ottima soluzione per chi cerca un adattatore WiFi efficiente e affidabile. Didn't immediately find my wireless router in Windows XP, but after manually entering the profile and rebooting, there it was connected.  I used the driver-only installation off the included CD, and it worked for both Windows XP and Windows 7 after I finished upgrading that same computer.  After re-installing the drivers on the fresh install of Windows 7, the adapted did find my wireless network on its own, so the original issue might have just been a Windows XP issue.  I can't speak to speed other than it seems to easily keep up with my wireless-G router.  When I get the wireless-N unit set up, I may try to update the review. Either way, worked and continues to work, and for the price it's hard to beat.

So I did not contact tech support. Maybe it would have helped, but there's too much that I feel is wrong. 1. The box says driver free. - But you are instructed to download a driver. ???? 2. The box has a sticker on the back to contact support. This was something they had to have printed then stuck on the back of the product. Now that tells me two things, 1) at least they are trying to fix a known issue. And 2) they have had design issues and something's not working. I followed the instructions provided. Once I plugged it in to my PC, an icon popped up notifying me of a new drive. I tried to right-click but the wheel kept spinning, never doing anything. Freezing up file explorer and not allowing me to do anything else. Unplugged, tried again, same thing. But now the icon was more fleshed out to an image. Progress? I downloaded the driver for this driver-less device. Did the install, now I can't even get an icon. Restarted the computer as directed. It froze up during restart, had to do it again. Still didn't work. Left the USB plugged in, frustrated I thought I'd try it later. A couple of hours later, success! It worked! For less than a half hour I had wi-fi. I could have contacted support, I did not. I bought a 40' cat6 Ethernet cord for 1/3rd the price. I will return this tomorrow. Direct connection is better anyway, had I done that in the first place, I'd be enjoying the fiber internet I'm paying for.

I have lots of computer accessories from UGreen.  They are an established brand, and have quality gear. Their support has always been quick to help as well. This product is no different. It has a nice metal case, and a GREAT longer cord, 13 inches according to my tape measure. Note that this is 10Gbps dock.  Not 5Gbps like most of them. This is what you want for top performance from your NVME USB caddy! I've converted most of my USB accessories to USB-C. It's a pet peeve of mine, when a dock plugs into USB-C, then doesn't give you one back. THIS dock is the opposite.  It plugs into a USB-A 3.2 10Gbps, and gives you two USB-C 10Gbps back :)  NICE.  Add in a USB-A 3.2 jack, and a USB2 jack for your KB/mouse, and life is good. Ethernet is gigabit.  I would have preferred a 2.5Gbps NIC there instead for a perfect world. Very nice dock.  REALLY nice price.  I like it üòä

reviews.review_title: Works with iPhone and iPad out of the box
reviews.review_text: This Ugreen USB-C Ethernet adapter with 2.5G speed uses the Realtek RTL8156BG chipset which is compatible "out-of-the-box" with APPLE iPhone, iPad and Macbook - no drivers required. Please note the other Ugreen product, the 1G version may not be compatible, please check the specific chipset: The 1G one I got had a AX88179 chipset which didn't work with Apple iPhone BUT is said to work better with Nintendo Switch. This 2.5G version is a good one however for Apple - maxes out my gigabit fibre internet on my iPhone 16 Pro.

reviews.review_title: extra speed with more security than wi fi
reviews.review_text: plug and play it is true with window 11 if the laptop have the built-in drive for this adaptor. if not you can download the software from realtek.it is working on usb4-c port of the laptop.i use a lan cable cat 8. i decide to put the wi fi off on the laptop to have a better speed on my other wi fi devices. i am very satisfy for this adaptor. extra info. it is working if your laptop have a built-in compatibility with this adapter. to check that,you go to window settings under network and internet.after you plug in the adapter to the laptop on the port of usb type c and a lan cable to the router. you can click on properties of ethernet on window settings. if you see realtek usb 2.5 gbe family controler,your laptop is compatible. if not you go on line directly to realtek site and download that software by choosing window 11. my laptop have a usb4 type c but a port of usb 3.2 gen 2 type c must working also.  about the lan cable plug on this adapter work better with cat 8 but cat 7 or 6 probably work also. my router have a 10 ge lan port. it is where i plug the lan cable from the adaptor. if you using a 1 ge lan port,can influance the speed of your internet. another important factor about the speed of internet is the plan you have. i have a internet plan of 2 gigs. the result of speed is 2170 mbps for download and 216 mbps for upload. i have not try to do aggregation on my router because this speed is an off for me. because i have other wi fi devices on my network i decide to put the wi fi off on my laptop to increase the speed on this other devices. if you have more question ask copilot in window. this ai know a lot.

reviews.review_title: It is able to archive download Upload speed 2.5Gbe
reviews.review_text: I tried connecting to an iPad Pro 2022 version and performed an iperf test, both upload and download speeds were able to reach 2.4~2.5Gbe speeds. Yes, it is supported on the iPad Pro device. After a few days of testing, the USB does not drop any packets or disconnect. It works perfectly fine. As for the heat, it's not excessively hot either. It is recommended to buy this if this is your first 2.5Gbe usb ethernet. Worth it.

I recently purchased the UGREEN USB C to Ethernet Adapter 2.5G for my MacBook Pro, and I couldn‚Äôt be happier with the performance! The sleek aluminum design not only looks great but also feels sturdy and high-quality. Setting it up was a breeze‚Äîjust plug it into my USB-C port, and I was online in seconds. The 2.5G speed is impressive! It significantly boosted my internet connection compared to standard Wi-Fi, especially during video calls and large file downloads. I noticed a marked difference in stability and speed, making streaming smooth and lag-free. This adapter is compact and portable, making it perfect for on-the-go use. Whether I'm at home or working in a caf√©, it fits easily in my laptop bag without adding bulk. Overall, I highly recommend the UGREEN USB C to Ethernet Adapter for anyone needing a reliable and high-speed wired connection. It‚Äôs an excellent investment for enhancing your internet experience, and the performance has exceeded my expectations. Five stars! üåü

reviews.review_title: Recensione dell'Adattatore TP-Link UE300 da USB 3.0 a Gigabit Ethernet - Ottimo Prodotto
reviews.review_text: L'Adattatore TP-Link UE300 da USB 3.0 a Gigabit Ethernet √® un'ottima scelta per chi ha bisogno di una connessione internet cablata affidabile e veloce. Questo adattatore compatto e portatile offre una soluzione senza problemi per laptop e desktop senza porta Ethernet integrata, garantendo una connessione stabile per attivit√† che richiedono internet ad alta velocit√†, come streaming, gaming e trasferimento di file di grandi dimensioni. Design e Qualit√† Costruttiva Il TP-Link UE300 vanta un design elegante e minimalista. √à compatto, con un corpo leggero in plastica che lo rende facile da trasportare in una borsa per laptop o addirittura in tasca. La finitura bianca e i bordi arrotondati gli conferiscono un aspetto moderno, e il cavo USB integrato ha una lunghezza sufficiente per fornire flessibilit√† nel collegamento a vari dispositivi. Prestazioni Le prestazioni del UE300 sono eccezionali. Sfruttando la tecnologia USB 3.0, supporta velocit√† fino a 1 Gbps, rendendolo significativamente pi√π veloce rispetto agli adattatori USB 2.0 tradizionali. Durante i test, l'adattatore ha fornito una connettivit√† costante e ad alta velocit√†, con una latenza trascurabile. Che si tratti di scaricare file di grandi dimensioni, guardare video in alta definizione o giocare online, il UE300 mantiene una connessione stabile e rapida. Compatibilit√† e Facilit√† d'Uso Una delle caratteristiche pi√π interessanti del TP-Link UE300 √® la sua capacit√† plug-and-play. Non richiede driver aggiuntivi per la maggior parte dei sistemi operativi moderni, tra cui Windows, macOS, Chrome OS e Linux. Basta collegare l'adattatore a una porta USB 3.0 e inserire un cavo Ethernet, e si √® pronti all'uso. Questa facilit√† d'uso lo rende una scelta ideale per gli utenti che necessitano di una soluzione rapida e senza problemi. Rapporto Qualit√†-Prezzo Considerando le sue alte prestazioni e la qualit√† costruttiva affidabile, il TP-Link UE300 offre un eccellente rapporto qualit√†-prezzo. √à proposto a un prezzo competitivo, rendendolo accessibile alla maggior parte degli utenti senza compromettere le prestazioni o le caratteristiche. L'inclusione di una porta Ethernet gigabit in un fattore di forma cos√¨ compatto √® particolarmente impressionante, rendendo questo adattatore un modo conveniente per migliorare la connettivit√† di dispositivi pi√π vecchi. Conclusione Nel complesso, l'Adattatore TP-Link UE300 da USB 3.0 a Gigabit Ethernet √® un accessorio di prima classe per chiunque abbia bisogno di una connettivit√† internet cablata migliorata. La combinazione di alta velocit√†, facilit√† d'uso e portabilit√† lo rende una scelta eccellente nella sua categoria. Che tu sia un professionista che necessita di una connessione affidabile per lavoro o un giocatore in cerca di ridurre la latenza, il TP-Link UE300 √® una soluzione affidabile ed efficiente. Pro: Supporto Ethernet gigabit ad alta velocit√† Design compatto e portatile Configurazione plug-and-play facile Ampia compatibilit√† con vari sistemi operativi Prezzo accessibile Contro: La costruzione in plastica potrebbe non essere cos√¨ resistente come le alternative in metallo In sintesi, il TP-Link UE300 √® un investimento fantastico per chi ha bisogno di un modo rapido e affidabile per migliorare la propria connettivit√† internet. Altamente raccomandato!

reviews.review_title: Works for my Sony X900H TV!
reviews.review_text: Most Sony TVs are gimped with 100mbs ethernet speeds, but I wanted to maximize as much internet speed I have as possible (1000/40mbps). Wifi is pretty good, but the speeds varied quite a bit. At the time of testing, the speed tester app (search it in the Google store app on your TV), I was getting 280mbps ish. I searched online and reddit suggested this adapter and it worked! Straight plug and play! I'm now getting 900mbps+. This is a niche use case but could work for others in my situation! Note that, this fix only works for models starting from X900H onwards and updated to Android 10 supposedly. YMMV.

reviews.review_title: Good quality, cheap, works with 2016 MacBook Pro
reviews.review_text: I use this with my late 2016 MacBook Pro. In the past I have used a Thunderbolt to Gigabit Ethernet adapter for older MacBook Pros. This is small, lightweight and simple to use. As it uses USB 3.1 it has more than enough bandwidth to deliver 1Gbps connectivity. I was able to transfer data at 120MB/s (this obviously depends on your network and the other device you're connecting to).

This adapter works great with my Asus Zenbook laptop. No issues with connectivity and speed tests show full speed over the ethernet to UBS C conversion. The adapter is compact and the USB C plug is small enough to fit between the micro HDMI port and a USB A port on either side - no issues. It does get warm, but nothing alarming. There is a green connection indicator LED as well as a green activity LED indicator. Device is plug and play in Windows 10 with no drivers to install. Build quality feels on par with the cost of the item. There's no reason to overspend on a "name brand" as this one works great.

reviews.review_title: Sturdy, fast and does not heat after long use
reviews.review_text: I wanted a good ethernet adapter for my laptops (mac and windows). So I tested it both on Mac and windows and got similar speeds touching 1Gbps(mac consistently gives 900+ mbps). I recently updated my internet connection and WiFi simply was not enough as WiFi caps at 200-400 Mbps. This on the other hand gives access to the full bandwidth. It's plug-and-play and doesn't require any driver installs. Feels very sturdy. I have bought Cable creation cables before and they are really good quality stuff. I like their products and I prefer selecting them over others because of the quality I have got till now. This adapter is no exception and does what it says.

reviews.review_title: Excellent, Basic, Adapter Poses a Great Value
reviews.review_text: I ordered this product when I ordered the new MacBook Pro with USB C. I think there is very little that can be done to make a USB C to ethernet adapter "special," but this one is an excellent product. It has a simple, compact, design - and the black looks great with the space gray of the laptop. I compared this to an Apple brand model and the speed was the same. I have no complaints and am satisfied with my purchase. Please note, however, that with some USB C devices a driver may need to be downloaded in order to use the product. I highly recommend this product.

The product is really good and was delivered on time in perfect condition. Tested both in Mac (Macbook air) and windows (Lenovo Z50). Driver for LAN connection available on Tplink website, link and installing options described in manual provided with the product. Test Run: 1. On Mac with LAN driver from tplink installed, everything runs perfectly. All three 3.0 USB ports can be used at the same time plus LAN connection too. 2. On Windows, LAN connection worked perfectly only after installing the driver from Tplink website. My windows laptop 3.0 USB was not powerful enough to power this adapter for my external hard drive to detect, so only pendrives can be used simultaneously in all three 3.0 USB ports (I think depends on your laptop).

~ There are many USB to LAN (RJ-45) adapters available starting right from 500 bucks but believe me when i say those adapters will stop working over the time, most probably after five to six months of continuous usage. ~ Another downfall of cheap adapters is that most of them just aren't USB 3.0 compatible so if you have a high speed internet connection then you can expect a loss in internet speeds. ~ If you use the adapter on a daily basis I suggest you go with this. It's relatively cheap when compared to other premium adapters. ~ It is USB 3.0 compatible, It supports up-to 1 Gb/s. ~ It also has a LED indicator on the front side. ~ The wire is super strong and very durable. ~ It has also got 2yrs Warranty. ~ It's MacOS and Linux compatible.

No joke, I took it out of the package, plugged it into the USB slot on the backside of my switch dock (inside the door), plugged in the ethernet cable and turned my switch on. It was seriously that easy!! It immediately recognized it was wired in (my wifi symbol changed to a wire in the top right corner of my screen) and gone were my wifi woes. I thought for sure I'd have to update settings and whatnot to have it click over, but nope. I've recommended this one to a few friends already, because it's working that well for me and how simple it was to 'install'

reviews.review_title: Niggles in set up, but great overall.
reviews.review_text: So, grabbed this because the new 4k Smart TV I have from Toshiba has a network card inside that just doesn't do the job for streaming games etc to it. Grabbing this, there's no drivers to install on an Android TV, but I found plugging it in as expected whilst the TV is on standby led to whenever I tried to go into settings to check, the TV would freeze and reboot. A quick unplug, wait and plug back in resolved this issue and now everything is working fine (leaving the adaptor plugged in and connected to a live network cable). Just remember some TV's (like mine) turn off the USB ports when on standby, so it takes a few seconds to reconnect each time you turn it on - but the settings issue hasn't returned. All in all a good product that does the job you need it to do - streaming is now flawless speeds, if only the Steam Link app wasn't so flaky!

It gives better performance than the official HORI adapter that's capped at 100mbps anyway. Does not work for LG TV - some folks were using adapters like this for their TV's but I think an LG TV update stopped devices like this from working with their TVs

I am starting to buy a lot more products from the UNI brand - they are good value for money, generally a lot cheaper than the major brands and they tend to have good quality chips / controllers built in. The customer service people are friendly plus all the products I've bought from them come with lifetime warranty like the major brands so why pay more? Saying that it is always wise to check out the quality of electronic products, but UNI seem to be doing the right things with quality control as far as I can see. I ran the device on Windows 10 on two different ASUS computers and works straight out of the box / plug and play... (It's always a good idea to check for driver updates for the device using Windows Update or Device Manager.).. I made a point to do that and Windows provided an updated driver so it was worth doing. It runs on Realtek USB GbE Family Controller - I have always found Realtek to be very reliable and good quality. The device definitely works at 1Gbps speed allowance (as expected for a Realtek controller). Weighs appx 29g so it is very light. The USB cable is relatively thick, stiff, and nicely braided, and the connector is well made / anodised-aluminium layered and fits securely into USB ports. The device itself is layered in dark grey anodised-aluminium which protects it well and also helps heat to dissipate. Its definitely a perfect size for travel - small and light enough to carry but just big enough that you wont misplace it easily. And the UNI emblem is cute and simple as well - doesn't take away from the overall look of things. The power and data lights are of decent brightness as well. I like the fact that the packaging is very simple - no plastic / no unnecessary packaging to go in the bin - just a simple little box that provides enough protection for transport. Definitely worth buying and trying it out.

Der Acer USB C Hub ist ein elegantes und vielseitiges Zubeh√∂r, das meine Aufmerksamkeit von Anfang an auf sich gezogen hat. Sein Design ist beeindruckend und die robuste Verarbeitungsqualit√§t gibt mir Vertrauen in seine Haltbarkeit. W√§hrend meiner Nutzung stellte ich fest, dass alle Anschl√ºsse einwandfrei funktionierten und meine Erwartungen in Bezug auf Leistung und Zuverl√§ssigkeit erf√ºllten. Der integrierte Gigabit-Ethernet-Anschluss gew√§hrleistet eine schnelle und stabile kabelgebundene Netzwerkverbindung, die f√ºr Aufgaben, die einen Hochgeschwindigkeits-Internetzugang erfordern, von entscheidender Bedeutung ist. Dar√ºber hinaus sorgten die USB-A 3.1-Anschl√ºsse f√ºr schnelle Daten√ºbertragungsgeschwindigkeiten, sodass die Datei√ºbertragung zwischen Ger√§ten nahtlos war. Eine der praktischen Funktionen des Hubs ist seine PD 100W-Ladefunktion, mit der ich kompatible Ger√§te schnell aufladen und gleichzeitig verbunden bleiben konnte. Dar√ºber hinaus erleichterte mir das Vorhandensein eines SD-Karten- und Micro-SD-Leseger√§ts den Zugriff auf auf Speicherkarten gespeicherte Dateien, sodass keine zus√§tzlichen Adapter erforderlich waren. Der USB-zu-VGA-Splitter sorgt f√ºr zus√§tzliche Flexibilit√§t, erm√∂glicht Verbindungen zu √§lteren Anzeigeger√§ten und erh√∂ht die Vielseitigkeit des Hubs. Insgesamt empfand ich den Acer USB C Hub als zuverl√§ssiges und gut gestaltetes Zubeh√∂r, das die Konnektivit√§tsoptionen f√ºr unterwegs erweitert. Ich kann ihn w√§rmstens empfehlen.

reviews.review_text: Il prodotto √® valido, ma purtroppo ha una limitazione per me esiziale: se si utilizzano simultaneamente le porte VGA e HDMI, ad esempio per collegare due monitor, entrambe le uscite ricevono il medesimo segnale, come se fossero duplicate (viene infatti rilevato un solo monitor). Questo √® seccante, anche perch√© prodotti meno costosi, come il Wavlink usb hub 7 in 1, supportano pienamente la gestione di due monitor separati (modalit√† duplicata o estesa), collegati alle porte VGA e HDMI. Considerato il prezzo, il marchio e la limitazione in oggetto, non mi sento di assegnare pi√π di tre stelle.

Comme √† mon habitude, pas d√©√ßu par les produits TP-Link. Pour le prix, je ne m'attendais pas √† autant de bons points. Contexte : J'ai un ordinateur portable (style ultraportable tr√®s fin), et en le nettoyant, les connecteurs des antennes de la carte r√©seau (wifi 6 et bluetooth 5) se sont cass√©s. Port√©e du wifi r√©duite √† n√©ant et utilisation du bluetooth impossible, et trop compliqu√© √† r√©parer sans risque. J'ai besoin du wifi et du bluetooth pour mon usage, et j'ai un ordinateur sous Linux (ubuntu 22.04 actuellement). Je n'ai qu'un seul port USB type A, et impensable pour moi d'avoir un hub sur mon port USB-C pour utiliser le bluetooth. C'est la seule cl√© potable et pas trop ch√®re qui fait wifi et bluetooth dans un aussi petit format que j'ai trouv√©. Je m'attendais √† avoir un r√©sultat pas terrible, mais apr√®s quelques r√©glages (son du casque en SBC notamment) j'ai pu connecter deux appareils bluetooth (casque et souris) en m√™me temps que le wifi. Pas de soucis particulier lorsque je suis dans la m√™me pi√®ce que la box, ou juste dans une pi√®ce juste √† c√¥t√©. Entre 50 et 60Mb/s sym√©trique, ce qui est honorable pour une cl√© de cette taille, sans antenne externe, amplement suffisant pour 95% des usages. √âvidemment, quand on s'√©loigne un peu, le wifi saute toutes les 30 secondes et c'est inutilisable. Mais comme solution de remplacement pour des gens qui utilisent leur ordinateur pas trop loin de la box, c'est vraiment parfait. Cependant, cela ne convient pas pour les gens qui ont l'habitude de jouer, il faudra investir un peu plus costaud pour ne pas √™tre emb√™t√©. Conclusion, pour mon usage de tout les jours, je vais garder la cl√© wifi/bluetooth branch√©e sur le port USB, et je vais racheter une autre cl√© wifi avec des antennes externes avec un gain plus √©lev√©, qui servira quand je serais dans des endroits o√π la couverture wifi est un peu moins bonne. Vraiment √©tonn√© par la qualit√© de cette cl√©, je recommande pour redonner une seconde vie √† un PC portable dont la carte r√©seau ne fonctionne plus, ou simplement √† des PC qui n'ont pas de bluetooth et o√π le wifi est trop vieux pour √™tre efficace. Tr√®s bonne finition. (Seul point n√©gatif, niveau emballage, on peut faire mieux pour une cl√© de cette taille, c'est peut-√™tre pas n√©cessaire le carton aussi grand avec tout les plastiques √† l'int√©rieur)

reviews.review_title: USB to Ethernet connection, works solid with high speed!
reviews.review_text: This device is pretty small but effective. It just plugs into the computer via USB port. You then plug a standard Ethernet cable into the other end, and thats it... The computer automatically registers the USB port as an Ethernet connection to the internet, and you'll get a wired-connection symbol on your internet icon in the taskbar tray. It is obviously not optimal speed, as the data has to pass through the Adapter first. However, I bought this as an emergency Ethernet for my Desktop PC, as it has no wireless card and the Ethernet port went bad. It works spectacularly. It was a tad slower, but not by a whole lot, I was still able to download a 3GB game in a few minutes. This product is also great if you have a laptop that does not have an Ethernet port and you need to wire directly without WiFi. For NON-TECH people: I literally only needed to plug it in the USB, then into the Internet Cable. And BAM internet. Works and gives a solid speed. also, it is pretty cheap on the wallet, but its not super cheap feeling in the hand/plugged in.Its good for the price for sure.

reviews.review_title: Just works, but really slow on Android
reviews.review_text: There's no much to say about this simple USB adapter. I plugged it into USB 2.0 on a couple of Android devices (including Chromecast GTV and Fire Stick), and USB 3.1 on a Windows 10 laptop. In all cases the system accepted it silently and showed "ethernet connected". It just worked, no fuss with setup or installing drivers. On Windows 10 it was fast, easily maxing out the connection. On Android it was slow and erratic, in fact slower and more erratic than WiFi. Also no information about the connection was available to Android -MAC address and IP address and connection parameters shown as "unknown", even though it worked. I your Android device has decent WiFi, you probably don't want to replace it with this.
Does what it is designed to do. No faults there. Decent shape, decent price, decent quality. Only concern is the 'usb' part, as it fits very loosely on my PC where as other USB items fit perfectly.

reviews.review_title: Worked great for exactly 10 months, then the wifi broke.
reviews.review_text: I bought this for a HTPC (home theater PC) which gets used maybe once or twice a week. It's an old Dell OptiPlex 3020 and it doesn't have built-in WiFi or Bluetooth, so I bought this solution for using a Bluetooth keyboard and mouse with the added bonus of not needing to also buy a WiFi adapter. Fast forward to last night when, in the middle of catching up on Windows 10 updates, it suddenly disconnects from the network‚Äîno networks available. Bluetooth was working fine. No other device in my house had this issue. I tried rolling back the Windows 10 updates, thinking that was the problem, to no avail. I even got frustrated enough to break out my old Windows 7 DVD and did a clean install, same thing. No networks available. Amazon requires reviewers to give at least one star, so I'll give you something positive about this unit: "If you need a WiFi solution for precisely 10 months, I can fully recommend the USB WiFi Bluetooth Adapter, 1300Mbps Dual Band 2.4/5Ghz Wireless Network External Receiver, Mini WiFi Dongle for PC/Laptop/Desktop." Otherwise, do what i'm doing and try the TP-Link Archer T2UB Nano that's also much more compact and, at the time of writing, is actually $3 cheaper AND from a trusted brand name. Thanks for reading, and good luck with your search.

The item states 1300Mbps but as you can see by the screenshot, it's only getting 70.45 Mbps download speeds, far below the 1300 Mbps advertised.  We use a 1G connection that is in the room next door with both doors open to make sure it's as unobstructed as possible. The Bluetooth works okay, I can get roughly 45 feet from the computer before the Bluetooth cuts out, i tested this with a 2nd gen Airpods. Overall, worth the $20 to get an all in one (WiFi and Bluetooth) but you must consider if the unit dies, you'll lose both WiFi and Bluetooth, but hey maybe that'll never happen, right, right? In a pinch they'll work to get my 50lb desktop to connect to our home WiFi network, but not like we're taking our 50lb. desktop computer to the local Starbucks to use their free WiFi, but if the WiFi or Bluetooth in any of our laptops should die, we can plug this in and away we go.

I will update my review if I find a way to obtain the required drivers in a stable state UPDATE 1: I found that if I uninstall the drivers that are installed when the device is plugged in I can plug in my previous devices and they'll work fine so maybe I can figure it out UPDATE 2: After spending a couple hours tinkering with it I have it working the way it should, it outperforms my old wifi adapter buy not my old bluetooth adapter still glad I got it because it allowed me to free up a usb slot

reviews.review_text: Recientemente, adquir√≠ el adaptador de red Netgear Nighthawk A8000 y me gustar√≠a compartir mi experiencia con este dispositivo. Velocidades Impresionantes: El rendimiento en cuanto a velocidad de conexi√≥n es sobresaliente. Tanto para juegos en l√≠nea como para streaming de video, el Nighthawk A8000 proporciona una conexi√≥n r√°pida y estable, mejorando significativamente la experiencia de uso. Contras: Precio Algo Elevado: Es cierto que el costo del Netgear Nighthawk A8000 es superior al de otros adaptadores en el mercado. Sin embargo, considero que la inversi√≥n vale la pena dada la calidad y el rendimiento que ofrece. En este caso, el precio refleja adecuadamente la calidad del producto. En conclusi√≥n: El adaptador de red Netgear Nighthawk A8000 es una excelente elecci√≥n para aquellos que buscan un dispositivo fiable, de alta velocidad y f√°cil de instalar. reviews.review_text: Mon ordinateur est dans un bureau s√©par√© du routeur Wifi 6 par environ 20 m√®tres, 1 √©tage et plusieurs cloisons, je cherchais un moyen de le connecter efficacement pour des usages vari√©s : travail, straming, cloud gaming. Cet adaptateur Netgear est plus imposant qu'une cl√© USB, mais sa rallonge et son pied aimant√© permettent de le poser o√π on veut sans bloquer plusieurs ports de son ordinateur. Il peut rester discret sous un bureau, mais avec son design moderne et √©l√©gant, vous pouvez aussi bien le laisser sur votre bureau. reviews.review_title: La migliore chiavetta compatta sul mercato
reviews.review_text: Ho recentemente acquistato la chiavetta USB WiFi Netgear A6150 e sono rimasto molto soddisfatto delle sue prestazioni. Questa chiavetta offre una connessione WiFi veloce e affidabile, consentendomi di godere di un'esperienza di navigazione senza interruzioni. Una delle caratteristiche principali di questa chiavetta USB WiFi √® la sua compatibilit√† universale con tutti i modem router. Indipendentemente dal modello o dalla marca del mio modem, la chiavetta A6150 si √® integrata senza problemi, permettendomi di connettermi alla rete WiFi in modo semplice e immediato. La velocit√† di connessione AC1200 √® un punto forte di questa chiavetta USB WiFi. Con questa velocit√†, ho potuto sperimentare una connessione internet rapida e stabile, che mi ha consentito di scaricare file, guardare video in streaming e giocare online senza problemi di buffering o ritardi. Ho apprezzato particolarmente la velocit√† di trasferimento dei dati, che mi ha permesso di spostare file grandi tra dispositivi in modo veloce ed efficiente. La facilit√† d'uso √® un altro aspetto positivo di questa chiavetta USB WiFi. Basta collegarla alla porta USB del mio computer e seguire le istruzioni per l'installazione. Il processo √® intuitivo e non richiede competenze tecniche avanzate. Inoltre, la chiavetta √® dotata di un'antenna regolabile, che consente di ottimizzare la ricezione del segnale WiFi e garantire una connessione stabile anche a distanza. La compattezza e la portabilit√† della chiavetta USB WiFi sono un vantaggio aggiuntivo. Grazie alle sue dimensioni ridotte, posso portarla con me ovunque vado, rendendo facile l'accesso alla connessione WiFi anche quando sono in viaggio o fuori casa. √à un accessorio comodo per coloro che desiderano una connessione affidabile in movimento. In conclusione, la chiavetta USB WiFi Netgear A6150 √® un prodotto affidabile e performante. La sua compatibilit√† universale, la velocit√† AC1200, la facilit√† d'uso e la portabilit√† la rendono una scelta eccellente per chiunque abbia bisogno di una connessione WiFi veloce e stabile. Consiglio vivamente questa chiavetta a coloro che desiderano migliorare la connettivit√† dei propri dispositivi e godere di un'esperienza di navigazione senza interruzioni.

reviews.review_title: Superb! + Can confirm working with Windows 10.
reviews.review_text: I built myself a new desktop PC a few days ago, finally moving back from laptops/all-in-ones, mainly for work purposes. I got an affordable WiFi adaptor and found my internet right down at standard Broadband speeds (5Mbps or so), which was frustrating. After upgrading to this thing, though, it shot up to the kind of speed I'd expect from my fibre connection, and about a third faster than any of my laptops or all-in-one computers reached. If I use the dock and cable and sit this thing on my desk, I get around 35Mbps from speedtest.net. That's right - it comes with a desktop dock, so you can move it away from all the interference your computer will cause and get maximum results. In desktop mode it also unfolds and extends if you need to squeeze a little extra speed out of it. I keep it folded up as it looks much nicer and tidier on my desk that way, but unfolding it does grant me a couple of extra Mbps if I'm in a squeeze (let's be honest, that's not often). If you're using a laptop and don't want to use the desktop dock, unfolded it'll sit at a decent distance from it to cut down on interference, but to be fair most laptops have built in WiFi these days, so you're more likely going to be using this on a desktop. To be honest, you need to use the desktop dock, because it's a little wideand plugged into a tower you'll find it ends up pointing sideways and obscuring the neighbouring USB ports, but the option is there if you really don't want it to be sitting on your desk. Sorted out all my WiFi problems and then some! Nice one guys! Also, I can confirm this is working like a charm on Windows 10 - UPDATE! After just under a month of use, one day I turned my PC on and it just didn't want to connect to the internet. After a lot of trial and error and frustration, the solution was to completely remove all traces of NetGear's drivers and just let Windows 10 do it's thing. In other words - IF YOU WANT THIS THING TO WORK WELL ON WINDOWS 10, DO NOT INSTALL THE SOFTWARE! JUST PLUG IT IN AND LET WINDOWS DO THE REST. NetGear's own software can cause conflict in Windows 10, but Windows 10 already has its own drivers etc to handle it for you.

reviews.review_title: Great! Not a single lag for 4 months
reviews.review_text: I have it for a 3-4 months now, my router is awful in terms of range. My PC is only 10m and one thick wall away from the router and in the same spot my Phone get's like barely 50-100mbps, where my PC with netgear get's 350-400mbps upload and downloadd, which is EXACTLY or sometimes even faster than via ethernet cable. I use internet for 16h a day (for games and downloading and uploading big files) and for 4 months i lost internet connection LITERALLY only like 5-10 times and it was for a 5 seconds max. In games I have stable ping (~30ms), maybe once every 3 hours I have spike to 100-150 for a few seconds, but I'm not sure if it's netgear or maybe my router or my internet. Cons - it's bigger than I thought (that's what she said) and it's just ugly (I have it on my desk on this stand) doesn't look good at all The cable could be a bit longer, but it's fine. It's fantastic for me but a lot depends on your internet and router quality, how thick are your walls etc.

Entonces he instalado solamente el driver para Windows 10, y lo estoy usando sin el software. Me ha dejado impresionado... Velocidad de v√©rtigo. Un par de veces no se me ha conectado al arranque y he tenido que reiniciar (no se que ha pasado). Estoy a la expectativa del tema de los micro cortes, pero nada de momento. Estoy muy contento con la compra.

The only issue really is the 2008 look of the program you use to connect to a network, but it works great. So, since you really don't use it that often, it's totally fine.

reviews.review_title: TOP! Hatte ich nicht erwartet, aber WLAN Speed hat sich verzehnfacht!
reviews.review_text: Seit Jahren versuche ich im OG einen PC im Kinderzimmer mit einem vern√ºnftigen Netzwerk zu versorgen. Da leider kein Coax LAN Kabel im Haus verlegt ist, muss entweder dLAN oder WLAN herhalten. Dies klappte bisher mehr schlecht als recht, obwohl ich fast alles ausprobiert habe, Im B√ºro steht eine Fritz!Box 7390 mit normalem 300 MBit WLAN im 2.4 und 5 GHz Band. Im Kinderzimmer hatte ich den AVM Fritz!WLAN N USB Stick mit 300 MBit im 2.4 oder 5 GHz Band. Ich habe nie Verbindungen mit mehr als 54 MBit zustande bekommen, meist war es weniger. Der Empfang war miserabel egal wo ich den Stick aufstellte. Entsprechend kam ich beim kopieren auf mein NAS auf kaum brauchbare 2.5 MB/s Transferrate. Backups und File Copies gehen endlos. Zwischenzeitlich habe ich noch an die Fritz!Box 7390 einen AVM 1750E Repeater im IP Bridge Mode geh√§ngt und das interne WLAN ausgeschaltet. Dachte ev. kriege ich mehr Signal im Kinderzimmer. Aber das war nicht der Fall mit dem AVM Wlan USB Stick am PC, ansonsten aber endlich AC WLAN mit gutem Signal im ganzen Haus, also gutes Upgrade, aber Kinderzimmer immer noch im WLAN Funkloch. Auch dLAN brachte da oben keine merkliche Verbesserung. Habe zuerst die 200er, dann 500er und nun noch die 1200er ausprobiert. Transferrate gerade mal 4-5 MB/s. Laut dLAN Cockpit ca. 100 MBit/s Verbindungsrate. Hatte es schon aufgegeben, den PC irgendwie vern√ºnftig ins LAN zu bekommen, bis ich mich entschlo√ü heute diesen USB WLAN Adapter zu bestellen und auszuprobieren. Die Hoffnung, dass es was bringt war aber eher gering nach all den Fehlversuchen in diesem verflixten Zimmer (auch meine Smartphones bekammen dort gerade so 1-2 Balken WLAN Signalst√§rke -80dBi, also zum Verzweifeln. Internet im Schneckentempo). Heute nun den Netgear A6210 ausgepackt. Neueste Treiber von der Homepage geladen und installiert. Und Stick in USB 3.0 Port gesteckt und Antenne aufgeklappt. In Netgear Genie die WLAN Verbindungsparameter (SSID und Passwort) eingegeben und an den Fritz!Repeater 1750E Accesspoint im 5GHz Band per AC WLAN verbunden. Und traue meinen Augen nicht: Verbunden mit ca, 585-702 MBit/s leicht schwankend, aber ca. 3-4 gr√ºne Balken und guter Empfang. Der 1750E zeigt Verbindungsraten von ca. 481 MBit/s an. Naja denke ich mir immerhin 10-mal mehr als die knapp 54 MBit/s und weniger mit dem AVN WLAN Stick. Also schnell mal ein File aufs NAS kopiert: Flutscht mit 10-11 MB/s also Faktor 4. Lesen mit 15-16 MB/s also Faktor 6 zu den urspr√ºnglichen 2,5 MB/s. Also f√ºr mich hat sich dieser Versuch gelohnt, f√ºr die knapp 43 ‚Ç¨ habe ich nun endlich mal einen WLAN Adapter, der vern√ºnftige Transferraten im WLAN erlaubt, selbst in diesem abgeschatteten Zimmer. Ist zwar kein GBit LAN und theoretisch h√§tte ich auch mehr Durchsatz beim Kopieren erwartet nach den traumhaften Verbindungsraten, aber jetzt habe ich zumindest mal 100 MBit Ethernet Kabel Niveau und das reicht f√ºr Backups und gro√üe Filetransfers aufs NAS gut aus. Das elendige Warten beim Kopieren von gr√∂√üeren Files hat nun endlich ein Ende. Kann den Adapter nur Empfeheln. Installation 10 min. und funktioniert einwandfrei f√ºr das was ich bisher sehen konnte. Der beste Wlan Adapter, den ich bisher hatte und ja AC Wlan lohnt sich wirklich. Die Reichweite und der Durchsatz im Netz sind Klasse und das im 5GHz Band. Alle Nachbarsnetze funken auf 2.4GHz. Da gebe ich doch jetzt glatt 5 Sterne.
Easy installation and very good connectivity!

reviews.review_title: Netgear A6210 (AC1200) Wi-Fi USB 3.0 Dual Band Adapter replaces internal adapter

reviews.review_title: Treiber-Probleme geh√∂ren im Jahr 2018 wohl endlich der Vergangenheit an
reviews.review_text: Ich habe mich von den negativen Rezensionen nicht abschrecken lassen und mir den Netgear A7000 geg√∂nnt. Die vielfach beschriebenen massiven Treiberprobleme konnte ich mit aktuellem Win10 nicht beobachten (Kauf 11/2018). Ehrlich gesagt war die Installation tats√§chlich reines Plug&Play. Ich bin wie folgt vorgegangen: Ich habe mir von der Netgear-Seite den Standalone-Treiber runtergelanden (diese Treiberversion kommt ohne die ebenfalls oft kritisierte Netgear-Software, finde es auch tats√§chlich besser, wenn das WLAN √ºber die Boardwerkzeuge von Windows gemanaget wird, eine Zusatzsoftware bringt hier m.M.n keine Vorteile). Dem Installationshinweis auf der Verpackung folgend habe ich die Treiberinstallation VOR dem Anstecken des Wifi-Adapters gestartet. Und siehe da: runs like a charme! Keinerlei Verz√∂gerungen beim Windows-Start, keinerlei Verbindungsverluste oder sonstige Probleme. L√§uft einfach nur sau schnell, wobei ich die maximale Geschwindigkeit gar nicht ausreizen kann, da mein Router nur 2x2 Antennenkonfigurationen unterst√ºtzt. Ich habe mir den A7000 trotzdem gekauft, da der kleine Netgear AC1200-Bruder zum Kaufzeitpunkt nur etwa sieben Euro billiger war und ich den Adapter station√§r am Desktop-Rechner betreibe. Letzteres ist ein Punkt: wer einen Adapter f√ºr sein Laptop anschaffen m√∂chte sollte zu einem kleineren Adapter greifen. Der A7000 ist gro√ü und breit, wirklich verdammt gro√ü und breit! Diskussionsw√ºrdig w√§re lediglich, warum der Standfu√ü einen so starken Magneten beherbergen muss, dass man ihn von Festplatten und anderen Magnetspeichern fern halten sollte.

I had an older WiFi adapter for my PC and was seeing intermittent connection issues that were causing me a lot of frustration. I got this adapter in the hope that it would improve my connection to the router in the room next door. After replacing the old adapter with this, my download speeds have doubled and the connection issues no longer occur.  It's a godsend for always online games that disconnect you once your WiFi connection drops.  I've seen an improvement in my latency in online games as well. Overall, I'm very happy with the purchase!

reviews.review_title: Random drop outs and has awful driver support.  Avoid until better driver support is available.
reviews.review_text: The device comes with a driver on it and appears as a USB stick.  After installation, the USB stick part disappears and uninstalling the driver doesn't bring it back, so good luck trying to get at your original driver unless you have another device available to download it.  At the time of writing, there's only 2 driver revisions available for Windows 10.  Those are 5001.0.13.104 supplied and 5001.0.15.110 available for download on the Asus website.  I stupidly thought that with a new driver available, this would be a safe product to purchase.  Depending on your system, they may or may not work for you.  The older driver seems to work, but will occasionally drop the connection.  The latest one (5001.0.15.110) also works, but seems to cause the blue screen of death randomly and also prevents your computer from shutting down for several minutes.  As a result, it will also cause your dump a bug report to your drive.  In my case, it's 770MBs in size, and it's not doing my SSD life any favours.  I've had to revert to the older driver.  I can live with the occasional random drops, but I'm not impressed.  Asus used to bring out quality products, but it doesn't seem to be the case any more.  Asus need to get their act together.

Esta unidad va muy r√°pida con un router Wifi 6, en mi caso Asus de hecho he ganado 100 mbs m√°s, pero hay acaba, se conecta y desconecta cada 5 minutos y los driver proporcionados por Asus dentro del USB WIFI que te obliga a instalar un programa lleva drivers obsoletos, cuando los drivers son de realtek y est√°n mas actualizados en su pagina. A todo esto se le suma otro grav√≠simo fallo y es que han cometido el error de meter una peque√±a memoria interna para alojar de manera absurda este driver obsoleto, detectando windows el USB WIFI como una memoria de almacenamiento hasta instalar dichos drives para que lo reconozca como un USB WIFI, con todo esto crea confusi√≥n al sistema debido a que constantemente se desconecta creyendo que es una memoria USB, cosa sin sentido ya que los DRIVES est√°n en internet y no es necesario hacer eso, driver obsoletos en la web de Asus tambi√©n. No recomendado para nada.

reviews.review_title: Works great if you have an 802.11AX router/node
reviews.review_text: At 1,201mbps speed as indicated by Windows (see attachment) on my old (1st gen I7), this is higher theoretical speed on USB3 than the theoretical 1gbps ethernet plug of that era. My data connection is only 500mbps, which this device easily supports (actually, not theoretically) per Speedtest app, so the thing is not a bottleneck for my daily use and I seldom do machine to machine transfers so I don't care about maximums beyond what I can easily measure now. I'm sure it can easily produce higher transfer speeds in a different environment but this has been a speed and stability improvement for me. I have an 802.11AX wireless router connection. Easily worth the money for an external adapter. Great base and cord included.

reviews.review_title: Enhance desktop PC's internet connectivity. It's fast, reliable, and easy to use
reviews.review_text: The TP-Link Archer T3U Plus has been a significant upgrade to my desktop PC's connectivity. This isn't just a WiFi adapter, it's a powerful tool for seamless internet access. The AC1300Mbps USB 3.0 WiFi Dual Band Network Adapter is a standout feature. It provides fast and reliable internet connectivity, supporting speeds up to 1300Mbps. The dual-band functionality allows me to switch between 2.4GHz and 5GHz bands based on my needs, ensuring optimal performance. The High Gain Antenna ensures a strong and stable WiFi signal. Whether my desktop PC is close to the router or in a different room, the Archer T3U Plus delivers consistent internet connectivity. The MU-MIMO technology is another feature that I appreciate. It allows the WiFi adapter to serve multiple devices at once, improving efficiency and speed when multiple devices are connected to the network. The compatibility of the Archer T3U Plus is impressive. It supports Windows 11/10/8.1/8/7/XP and Mac OS 10.9-10.15, making it a versatile choice for various desktop PCs. The TP-Link Archer T3U Plus is a fantastic investment for anyone looking to enhance their desktop PC's internet connectivity. It's fast, reliable, and easy to use. Highly recommended!

reviews.review_text: Quick and simple. Plugged it in and loaded the program disk and off we go! My old computer lost its wifi board and this antenna kit made it work like new. Great product.
